commit_message:
Remove the LoadedExtensionInfo object

The LoadedExtensionInfo object is used to track the loaded API
extensions. Since the extensions are removed, this object is useless
now.

Partial implement bp api-extensions-merge-queens

Change-Id: Iab64fdb675be24b91b05f95a86f31d44439ad82e

[{'created': '2017-12-20 03:12:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extensions module

The most of objects are removed from the extensions module. The last
thing is the expected_errors decorator, but that decorator is nothing
about the extensions. So move the decorator to the wsgi module where
is the place put the other decorator also. Then we can remove the
extensions module entirely.

Partial implement bp api-extensions-merge-queens

Change-Id: I4802c5b38001a756448d4feb9ca336908821f591
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extensions module

The most of objects are removed from the extensions module. The last
thing is the expected_errors decorator, but that decorator is nothing
about the extensions. So move the decorator to the wsgi module where
is the place put the other decorator also. Then we can remove the
extensions module entirely.

Partial implement bp api-extensions-merge-queens

Change-Id: I4802c5b38001a756448d4feb9ca336908821f591

commit_message:
Move default release to Pike

Currently deployment is on Newton. Upgrade it to Pike release.

Change-Id: I3f88291416c15595810c43e76e22f267250e64a9
Closes-Bug: #1739641

"}, {'created': '2017-11-02 14:45:22.000000000', 'message': "Use db transactions when error-finish is called

Multiple spots were not using DB transactions when processing error
transitions:

  node_info.fsm_event(istate.Events.error)
  node_info.finished(error='Oops!')

which led to race conditions.

The patch replaces these racy calls with a refactored version of
NodeInfo.finished(), that expects an error event as an argument, upon
which the (terminal) error state should be navigated to.

Closes-Bug: #1721233
Closes-Bug: #1721230

Make _abort set error and finished_at in fms_event

TL;DR the fsm_transition decorator has no chance to update anything else
besides the node_info state attribute.  As a result, discrepancies such as
in the bug below could have been observed in an HA inspector deployment.

This patch moves the node_info.finished() and the
node_info.fsm_event(abort) into a single DB transaction to avoid the
discrepancies.

Closes-Bug: #1723384

Fix state discrepancy in process._finish

The _finish calls node_info.finished() inside while being decorated to
perform a 'finish' state transition, that sets node_info._state = finished
right after the _finish returns.  Therefore a window of state discrepancy
between the node_info.finished() and the node_info._state exists.

This patch closes that window by putting them into a single DB
transaction.

Change-Id: I0bb051d1956a996ed006d55a5ca2d670d9455047
"}, {'created': '2017-11-04 11:48:42.000000000', 'message': "Terminal state transitions in transactions

Multiple spots were not using DB transactions when processing the terminal
state transitions (error, abort, finish, timeout). The pattern looked like
this:

    node_info.fsm_event(istate.Events.error)
    # more code
    node_info.finished(error='Oops!')

which led to brief periodes of state inconsistency of NodeInfo records in
the DB.

This patch refactors the NodeInfo.finished() method to require a terminal state
transition to perform as part of the NodeInfo state update:

   NodeInfo().finished(istate.Events.finish)
   NodeInfo().finished(istate.Events.abort, 'Canceled by operator')

Closes-Bug: #1721233
Closes-Bug: #1721230
Closes-Bug: #1723384

Change-Id: I0bb051d1956a996ed006d55a5ca2d670d9455047

commit_message:
Terminal state transitions in transactions

Multiple spots were not using DB transactions when processing the terminal
state transitions (error, abort, finish, timeout). The pattern looked like
this:

    node_info.fsm_event(istate.Events.error)
    # more code
    node_info.finished(error='Oops!')

which led to brief periodes of state inconsistency of NodeInfo records in
the DB.

This patch refactors the NodeInfo.finished() method to require a terminal state
transition to perform as part of the NodeInfo state update:

   NodeInfo().finished(istate.Events.finish)
   NodeInfo().finished(istate.Events.abort, 'Canceled by operator')

This patch also introduces a new state: aborting to allow the inspector to
try call power-off the node before marking the introspection aborted.

There's a new DB migration since the new state implies a schema change too
(Enum).

Closes-Bug: #1721233
Closes-Bug: #1721230
Closes-Bug: #1723384

Change-Id: I0bb051d1956a996ed006d55a5ca2d670d9455047

commit_message:
Backport the native Zuul jobs to the stable branch

Squash together all the changes now that the jobs are stable enough.
The jobs (definitions and code) should be available in the stable
branches as well. This will be handled naturally in the future, when
stable/queens is branched from master.

Change-Id: Icf0e57cf948435cb2fee8d30b76369b6dba4c617

commit_message:
zuul: Add ability to specify a 'branch_override' value

To be able to run a job on a different branch add the ability to
specify a 'branch_override' value. We will use this in the
openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin testing to be able to check changes
against our stable branches.

Change-Id: I939ab8c410b39658b4209a41a91c3339802d134b

commit_message:
Performance: improve get_role

Now Keystone visits DB double times (if use cache, Keystone will
firstly visit DB and then visit cache) when the get_role API is
called.

This patch deleted the redundant second call to impove the
performance a little.

Change-Id: Ib863a1e4d402fa486fc2c50d27ec041be3ebf402

commit_message:
.gitignore: add translation catalogs (.mo and .pot)

Compiled translation catalogs (*.mo) and PO template files (*.pot)
are not maintained in the git repo.
This commit adds them to .gitignore.

commit_message:
Remove unused actions in FWaaS v2 dashboard

Some actions are unused. This seems to be added during development
and it looks better to drop them to avoid unnecessary confusion.

Also change the code to use 'name_or_id' attribute for
display names.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 17:13:44.000000000', 'message': "Include -E in tripleo-repos sudo calls

Without this any proxy settings in the environment won't be present
in the tripleo-repos env, which makes it fail behind a proxy.  Since
it won't hurt anything to use -E in all cases, let's just add it to
the documented calls.

Change-Id: I1b5ffacfc6b0b4fc31d59a831bcd5865f39cb223
"}]
commit_message:
Include -E in tripleo-repos sudo calls

Without this any proxy settings in the environment won't be present
in the tripleo-repos env, which makes it fail behind a proxy.  Since
it won't hurt anything to use -E in all cases, let's just add it to
the documented calls.

Change-Id: I1b5ffacfc6b0b4fc31d59a831bcd5865f39cb223

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I05fa4c3340294793863380386cbb9821601f66a4

[{'created': '2017-09-01 10:00:44.000000000', 'message': 'bgpvpn agent extension changes for supporting ovo in bagpipe

To handle resource push and pull by the bagpipe driver. the bgpvpn
agent extension must define and attach methods to handle objects.

Methods are define handle bgpvpn network associations and bgpvpn router
associations, formats the received objects and call already existing
methods to apply the changes.

Co-Authored-By: Omar Sanhaji <sanhaji.omar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>

commit_message:
bgpvpn agent extension, support for OVO-based push/pull RPCs

To handle resource push and pull by the bagpipe driver, the BGPVPN
agent extension must define and attach methods to handle objects.

Methods are defined to handle BGPVPN network associations and BGPVPN router
associations, format the received objects and call already existing
methods to apply the changes.

[This change also removes some constants from the agent extensions
that were duplicates of constants in bagpipe_bgp]

Co-Authored-By: Omar Sanhaji <sanhaji.omar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>

Partial Implements: blueprint bagpipe-bgpvpn-ovo

Change-Id: Ic6fbf5b465361e793f5aed1bcd9cef336b49e013
Depends-On: I2a6f6be511c8a729c50c9c82fba3972f893367ec

commit_message:
BGPVPN OVO connected networks fix

The code gathering connected networks behind a router was
subtly broken, a break instead of a continue in a loop was
causing some connected networks to sometimes be skipped, if
there was also a gateway network and if this gateway network
was appearing first in the iteration (random).

Change-Id: I25ef6058e03bf5077e76d872e54af64533ea69c0

subject: doc: update supported drivers for cpu topology

messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In Nova world today, NUMA topology feature depends on CPU topology feature, but CPU topology feature doesn't depend on NUMA topology feature.
So we can support CPU topology feature without cpu pinning. That means we can support it with libvirt/qemu backend.

It is in the spec[1] and I have tested this.

This is quote from the spec; "The intent is to implement this for the libvirt driver, targeting QEMU / KVM hypervisors. "

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/juno/implemented/virt-driver-vcpu-topology.html'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
doc: update supported drivers for cpu topology

Not only libvirt/KVM driver but also libvirt/QEMU works with cpu
topology feature in nova. So we just update the document.

Change-Id: If8f0229072c8518c9301a872b98862687d93a044

Migrate functional tests to stestr

The functional tests in tox.ini were still set to use testr,
this change makes it use the new stestr.

commit_message:
objects: Add PCI NUMA policy fields

Add the requisite policy field to 'InstacePCIRequests' for the
aforementioned feature. We also add a missing 'super' call for the
'obj_make_compatible' function of this object and add the missing unit
tests for same.

bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: I9360fe299083045a4baf4a703d2b53b3eb30a558

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-20 18:03:44.000000000', 'message': "Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances is using an admin context, which doesn't have a project_id
set, which means the request spec that gets created doesn't have
a project_id set, which matters when the FilterScheduler tries to
claim resources (create allocations in Placement) using said
request spec's project_id (PUT /allocations requires a non-null
project_id).

This fixes the online data migration by creating the request spec
using the instance's project_id rather than that from the context.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to
e211fca55a11c80058d5d78e31dc3ad466d7edfd which is not in
Ocata nor is it needed.

Change-Id: I214a44f0eee7d90be5cd89f32f6e0017b19a3fd6
Partial-Bug: #1739318
(cherry picked from commit a148e638dd5eaaa6f9c8749782a625c6523b6b6a)
(cherry picked from commit c86db10feb07d023b651fd9909e1039fe775424d)
"}]
commit_message:
Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances is using an admin context, which doesn't have a project_id
set, which means the request spec that gets created doesn't have
a project_id set, which matters when the FilterScheduler tries to
claim resources (create allocations in Placement) using said
request spec's project_id (PUT /allocations requires a non-null
project_id).

This fixes the online data migration by creating the request spec
using the instance's project_id rather than that from the context.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to
e211fca55a11c80058d5d78e31dc3ad466d7edfd which is not in
Ocata nor is it needed.

Change-Id: I214a44f0eee7d90be5cd89f32f6e0017b19a3fd6
Partial-Bug: #1739318
(cherry picked from commit a148e638dd5eaaa6f9c8749782a625c6523b6b6a)
(cherry picked from commit c86db10feb07d023b651fd9909e1039fe775424d)

A potential issue is that a tempfile is used for passing data to ganesha. This is not ideal if both manila and ganesha run in containers because then both would have to share also /tmp dir. After chatting with Ramana about this using of /etc/ganesha/exports.d (which is used by default for no-rados dynamic exports and is bind mounted in both containers) would be better.

Related error:
2017-11-09 12:09:48.262 40 ERROR manila.share.drivers.ganesha.manager [req-8407c4a1-cec1-4150-b48a-ac806e5a2912 6089ceb45caf4fdd9064de91e2d1115a 20fdf11e4fbe430e8db141fcdd2a89d4 - - -] Error while executing management command on Ganesha node <no name>: dbus call exportmgr.AddExport.: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
Command: dbus-send --print-reply --system --dest=org.ganesha.nfsd /org/ganesha/nfsd/ExportMgr org.ganesha.nfsd.exportmgr.AddExport string:/tmp/tmp.MhNLyw2FL3 string:EXPORT(Export_Id=1001)

[{'created': '2017-10-09 12:04:19.000000000', 'message': 'ganesha: store exports and export counter in RADOS

Allow the ganesha driver to store ganesha exports
and export counter as Ceph RADOS objects. This enables
highly available(HA) Ganesha servers in manila deployments
to store their config in a HA storage.

TODOs:
Unit tests
Driver Doc enhancements

Change-Id: Ia51156055fa10d0661e662c9c998829864f1a204

commit_message:
ganesha: store exports and export counter in RADOS

Allow the ganesha driver to store ganesha exports
and export counter as Ceph RADOS objects. This enables
highly available(HA) Ganesha servers in manila deployments
to store their config in a HA storage.

Implements: blueprint ganesha-ha-rados
Change-Id: Ia51156055fa10d0661e662c9c998829864f1a204

commit_message:
Fix duplicate allocation candidates

Some combinations of resource providers were duplicated in
allocation candidates.

This can happen when multiple sharing RPs are in the same aggregates,
because both sharing RPs visit each other during the algorithm to
see if it can be used as an allocation candidate's mate.

This patch adds to _alloc_candidates_with_shared() function a check
if we already have that combination in allocation candidates by
adding `alloc_prov_ids`, which is a list of sets of allocation
candidates's rp_ids.

Change-Id: Iefd3137ec68029d27081a743e52e327625585081
Closes-Bug:#1730730

commit_message:
Use doc/requirements.txt

The infra jobs expect documentation requirements in either
doc/requirements.txt or test-requirements.txt. Since neither is
available, they currently fail.

Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt and use that to
fix releasenotes build. Note that doc/requirements.txt needs some
requirements for code analysis of taskflow.

For the docs environment - which is a developer convenience - use the
same command that is used by OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: Iec65211e5059a4afdd88a45e2c1ac535b8ec97fe

commit_message:
zuul: Clean up zuul files

Changes to legacy-ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml:
  * Create two base jobs:
    * 'ironic-inspector-tox-func-base'
    * 'ironic-inspector-dsvm-base'
  * Put 'irrelevant-files' section into the new base jobs
  * Have 'requirements.txt' no longer be ignored for DSVM jobs
  * Simplify 'required-projects' sections by removing projects that
    are already pulled in by the 'legacy-dsvm-base' job.

Changes to project.yaml:
  * Move 'irrelevant-files' section from project.yaml to
    legacy-ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml
  * Sort the jobs list

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Add job for publishing built javascript content

There are two different types of tarballs we want to publish, a source
tarball to npm, and a built tarball intended for deployment. We have a
job for dealing with tarballs to npm, but we're lacking a new-style job
for publishing built artifacts to tarballs.o.o.

Add one, and switch storyboard to using it.

Change-Id: I19607d14facb93d1f46ea68feba563badfbbb5a2

commit_message:
Expose a bug when authorize request token

Keystone raise 500 error when authorize request token
with invalid body.

This patch expose the bug that keystone raise 500
error instead of 400 in this case.

Change-Id: I3ddeebf8a46467ed090d8831fd8cf35edee7ce04
Partial-Bug: #1736875

commit_message:
Drop tox-mysql-python job

Change Ie17f4543fa3d72b507d88d2c4023a9a5a430419e removed the
mysql-python support, remove the job for this.

This removes also the .zuul.yaml file, since the mysql-python job was
the only configured job.

Change-Id: I113ca2069a2e93482be0729857dde9737743da9a

[{'created': '2017-10-11 17:45:01.000000000', 'message': "Adding httpd-worker apache process on SLES

The apache2 process on SLES might be 'httpd-worker'. Otherwise
while running monasca-setup, the error is:
     ERROR: Apache process does not exist.

Change-Id: I27c757b9c3c3b93db7b3edd8e576147e94c32a4a
"}]
commit_message:
Adding httpd-worker apache process on SLES

The apache2 process on SLES might be 'httpd-worker'. Otherwise
while running monasca-setup, the error is:
     ERROR: Apache process does not exist.

Change-Id: I27c757b9c3c3b93db7b3edd8e576147e94c32a4a

commit_message:
block-storage refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- deprecated postgresql support
- dropped apt cookbook dependency
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket syntax
- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- migrated cinder api to a Chef-managed config
- deprecated cinder-group-active service, as it is no longer needed and gets in
  the way of functionality
- added lvm cookbook dependency for better pv/vg handling

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: Id248c9267af6750c871487bc8b577aa2011a782a

commit_message:
orchestration refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket syntax
- added interface for internal endpoint
- moved dpkg options to common cookbook

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: I361aed3d84a6e7225d7d803f1855ce37da568eac

commit_message:
Retire Packaging Deb project repos

This commit is part of a series to retire the Packaging Deb project.
Step 4 is to move the official project entry to the legacy list with
the current date marked as its retirement (as in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project).

Change-Id: Iae7729440969de5161b63412cf3d04668f0f44d7
Depends-On: I05c9e4a37ecb1eefe1909be3cb5fa56ee10710ff

commit_message:
Add assert:supports-accessible-upgrade to designate

With the new tests [1] in our grenade plugin, we now
test that DNS is resolvable while the Designate
services are not running.

1 - https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/designate/tree/devstack/upgrade/resources.sh#n148

Change-Id: Ic1e305bce823edc0a6771aea791b37cf3a1ad0a8

commit_message:
Implemented a policy enforcement engine

Under monasca_common/policy an enforcement engine is added for using
oslo.policy in the other monasca projects.
There are same methods as in enforcement engings currently used in
nova and keystone projects.
Also added unit tests under tests/policy for testing implemented
methods.

Task: 6105
Story: 2001233

Change-Id: Ic5402ba0986416c9386c1dc3fc1559f148ea9625
Signed-off-by: Amir Mofakhar <amofakhar@op5.com>

commit_message:
Fix unit test failures when direct IO not supported

We were executing supports_direct_io in unit tests, which affects
command line argument to qemu-img. This was causing unit test failures
when the test host's filesystem doesn't support direct IO, which isn't
relevant to the unit tests.

Change-Id: I9de6ffcadc4a49413626bf8b8bb3fe806230550f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 03:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in  cluster that guarantee High Availability to
required VNF in Tacker env.

This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as:
VNF cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.

On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers.
The recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed
cluster-member in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member ->
delete the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster

Change-Id: I777f967ae85b48ae684c888944c140a98c178196
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in  cluster that guarantee High Availability to
required VNF in Tacker env.

This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as:
VNF cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.

On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers.
The recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed
cluster-member in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member ->
delete the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster

Change-Id: I777f967ae85b48ae684c888944c140a98c178196
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>

Eg: doc/source/_static directory, CONTRIBUTING.rst ...
In order to fix all of them, I would like to suggest you to use "http://docs.openstack.org" as search pattern.
I understand there are lots of places needed to be fixed but hopefully you'll be able to cover all of them in the next patch set.
Thank you in advance.'}, {'account_id': 26734, 'date': '2017-10-16 14:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I agree with the above reviewer, in this case if we want to make some doc updates lets go through and make sure the pattern is completely covered within the repo. Thanks for your effort so far. Keep in mind a lot of old links also just redirect now(I believe we should still fix them up)'}, {'account_id': 26072, 'date': '2017-10-17 10:34:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Please update all the urls'}, {'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:07:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-2

This substantially duplicates an older patch, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492820/ .  Please contact the author of that patch, who has not recently responded to comments, about taking over the other patch as a co-author, and please abandon this patch.

Also, note that:
(1) .conf files are generated, do not change them like this.  You must change them in code (see comment on other patch)
(2) .po files are generated, do not change them like this (I believe the changes in code will be picked up automatically, contact the translations team to verify)
(3) It doesn't make sense to change a text fixture, it just muddies the history of the file."}, {'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2017-12-11 01:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> This substantially duplicates an older patch, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492820/
 > .  Please contact the author of that patch, who has not recently
 > responded to comments, about taking over the other patch as a
 > co-author, and please abandon this patch.
 > 
 > Also, note that:
 > (1) .conf files are generated, do not change them like this.  You
 > must change them in code (see comment on other patch)
 > (2) .po files are generated, do not change them like this (I
 > believe the changes in code will be picked up automatically,
 > contact the translations team to verify)
 > (3) It doesn't make sense to change a text fixture, it just muddies
 > the history of the file.

Oh，thank you for your review, I will abandon it."}, {'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2017-12-22 06:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use the integration-gate job-template

Projects in the integrated gate should use the integrated gate
job-template. The job template now uses the zuulv3 native job
tempest-full so updating for each project in the integrated
gate.

Change-Id: I0a40dbd39f4b357b6e8656c967b4d477f6102d5d

subject: Release python-blazarclient 0.3.1
messages:
[{'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Zuul says: "ERROR: Initial releases in a series must increment at least the minor version or be beta versions. '0.3.1'"'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-20 08:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 13:58:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The build-openstack-sphinx-docs failure is not related to this patch. See Sean's comment in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528026/"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-21 17:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 17:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 20:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 20:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

@Sean: this is our first release to PyPI, but not the first tag in Git. When Masahito only included 0.3.1 in the commit, openstack-tox-validate returned the following error:

"ERROR: Initial releases in a series must increment at least the minor version or be beta versions. '0.3.1'"

Should we make a separate commit for 0.3.0 first?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 20:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hmm, looks like there is already a 0.3.1 tagged:

https://github.com/openstack/python-blazarclient/releases/tag/0.3.1

Should this be 0.4.0?'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 20:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

No, this should be 0.3.1. I am not sure how Masahito created the 0.3.1 tag, we only want to push it to PyPI now.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 20:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Looks like acl's need to be fixed. Tag's should not be pushed directly, and now that there is one, we can't push it again. I'll have to check how we can get around this now.

Let's try a separate patch for 0.3.0. We should only do one per release anyway. We can try running that through and see what happens."}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

There were 0.1.0 and 0.2.0 before 0.3.0, would you recommend that we try to release them first?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:05:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

No, let's just start with 0.3.0."}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529699/'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Is pushing to PyPI going to work? I don't see 0.3.0 at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-blazarclient/"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:56:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Looks like we will need a 0.3.2 after this to get it to actually publish to pypi. I believe that is being skipped because it sees it's already tagged and doesn't need to do so again.

I should also point out there has not been a queens release yet. At this point it may be best to start there."}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks Sean. I will let our PTL Masahito propose a patch for 0.3.2.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2017-12-22 05:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks all.

Just info, I have created 0.2.0 and 0.3.0 tag following the release doc[1] as Blazar was not an official project at that time. And I did same for 0.3.1.

https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#tagging-a-release'}]

commit_message:
nova: add an option for no console

On AArch64 we run VMs without any graphics so nova console is not
available. For now we had to disable it by hand but it can be automated.

Change-Id: Ib903044493ca98c0dd29d3096f66272e130668b0

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-20 15:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2017-12-20 18:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-12-21 01:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Saw the discussion on IRC http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-barbican/%23openstack-barbican.2017-12-20.log.html, potential risk may exist in HA environment.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2017-12-21 15:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jeremy, are you proposing that we try to solve this here - possibly by making this initialization happen only during the db-sync?  

Thats a bit of a behavior change somewhat late in the cycle.  If we want to take this approach, I suggest we do so in the Rocky cycle, and push this change as-is for Queens.

If you agree, please +2 and workflow.   Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-12-22 01:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2017-12-22 01:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

alee, agree! We need to test this is HA env and propose a proper fix.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 17:52:26.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure only api app initializes secret store

Right now, the multiple secret store initialization code is run
whenever the db is initialized - whether it be running the clean
db script, starting the worker, starting the keystone listener
or manage db script.  This periodically causes deadlocks when
the worker,listener and app are started soon after each other.

Its not altogether clear why the deadlock happens, but the only
table that is being written to is the secret_store table, which
has no foreign keys etc.  In any case, though, it was never the
intention that anything other than the app itself initialize the
secret stores from its config file.

This patch makes sure that happens.

Change-Id: I711b91b19b9d65260a21b41d6f9e18b9e282138a
Fixes: 1738863
'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 15:56:24.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure only api app initializes secret store

has no foreign keys etc.  In any case, though, it was never the
intention that anything other than the app itself initialize the

This patch makes sure that happens.

Change-Id: I711b91b19b9d65260a21b41d6f9e18b9e282138a
Closes-bug: 1738863
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure only api app initializes secret store

Right now, the multiple secret store initialization code is run
whenever the db is initialized - whether it be running the clean
db script, starting the worker, starting the keystone listener
or manage db script.  This periodically causes deadlocks when
the worker,listener and app are started soon after each other.

Its not altogether clear why the deadlock happens, but the only
table that is being written to is the secret_store table, which
has no foreign keys etc.  In any case, though, it was never the
intention that anything other than the app itself initialize the
secret stores from its config file.

This patch makes sure that happens.

Change-Id: I711b91b19b9d65260a21b41d6f9e18b9e282138a
Closes-bug: 1738863

commit_message:
Use storage-environment.yaml in featureset024 for newton

Before the addition of puppet-ceph.yaml the 'sample' environment file
to use to enable Ceph was storage-environment.yaml

Change-Id: If05c4af22a9c52fffd7e5238459529ae7f4e3936
Related-Bug: #1739357

Hi, LIU. I have tested all your patches in bp floating-ip-rate-limit
 https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/floating-ip-rate-limit.Your patches  was worked well in my neutron environment. But I don't understand why you abandoned the last patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/.
This patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/ from Maxime  just set qos_policy_id in qg_xxx port actually in order to use by setting ovs-veth-port(https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1732852).
I have tested his patch with your patches, if set router-gateway-qos by using qg_xxx port, all traffics egress from qg_xxx port will be limited. And then set-floatingip-qos by using your patch will not useful， cause all rules will be reset by using router-gateway-qos from patch  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/. So this patch will confilct with all your patches, but I think your idea is more accurate. VM need floatingip qos not just simply set qos on qg_xxx port. I do hope you recover the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/ otherwise your patches confict with 
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/ from Maxime. THX"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:20:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Hi, LIU. I have tested all your patches in bp floating-ip-rate-limit
 > https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/floating-ip-rate-limit.Your
 > patches  was worked well in my neutron environment. But I don't

Thank you very much for testing this. : )

 > understand why you abandoned the last patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/.

This is a long story, maybe you can read it here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374506/14/specs/pike/layer-3-rate-limit.rst@349

 > This patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/ from Maxime 
 > just set qos_policy_id in qg_xxx port actually in order to use by
 > setting ovs-veth-port(https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1732852).
 > I have tested his patch with your patches, if set router-gateway-qos
 > by using qg_xxx port, all traffics egress from qg_xxx port will be
 > limited. And then set-floatingip-qos by using your patch will not
 > useful， cause all rules will be reset by using router-gateway-qos
 > from patch  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/. So this patch
 > will confilct with all your patches, but I think your idea is more
 > accurate. VM need floatingip qos not just simply set qos on qg_xxx
 > port. I do hope you recover the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/
 > otherwise your patches confict with
 > patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/ from Maxime. THX

This seems a true technical issue. Two potential ways for us to go forward:
1) if set `ovs_use_veth=True`, this floating IP qos agent extension will be silently disabled.
2) restore my router-gateway ip qos patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/ while `ovs_use_veth=False (default)`"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-05 17:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 21:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I made test of Your patch on my local devstack and it looks for me that it's not working (or I did something wrong which is more probable).
What I did exactly:
1. Spawn vm connected to some tenant network,
2. Create QoS policy with bandwidth limit rule (direction ingress)
3. Create floating IP on external network with configured QoS policy on it
4. Attach floating IP to VM's port
5. I wanted to check qdisc and filters configured by "tc" in qrouter namespace but there is nothing configured. In L3 agent logs there is also nothing about QoS and tc.

Can You tell me what I could do wrong with this test?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:06:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

ok, please ignore my previous comment. I forgot to add fip_qos l3 extension in l3 agent's config :)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

why You want to silently disable this extension if ovs_use_veth=True? In such case Your rate limits should works also, no?
BTW will Your extension works also for "internal" ovs ports instead of veth?
According to qos policy applied directly to router gateway port, maybe it's worth to mention in docs that both rate limits will not work together and maybe later report bug about that and fix it in future. What You think about that?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

one more question: shouldn't "ingress" qdisc be deleted from qg interface when floating ip is disassociated from port?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

So I did one more test for egress bw limit on FIP.
Results are on http://paste.openstack.org/show/628222/
It looks that limit is not set properly.
ovs_use_veth was set to True so limit was configured on veth port in qrouter namespace'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

One more thing. That is what I had configured in tc on this interface:

ubuntu@devstack-master-openvswitch ~ ❯❯❯ sudo ip netns exec qrouter-07c0b25a-4af1-40bf-b1e7-7207af439f4d tc qdisc show
qdisc noqueue 0: dev lo root refcnt 2
qdisc noqueue 0: dev qr-4694c1a9-e0 root refcnt 2
qdisc noqueue 0: dev qr-c1a947a1-cb root refcnt 2
qdisc htb 1: dev qg-a295bdfa-15 root refcnt 2 r2q 10 default 0 direct_packets_stat 416 direct_qlen 1000
ubuntu@devstack-master-openvswitch ~ ❯❯❯ sudo ip netns exec qrouter-07c0b25a-4af1-40bf-b1e7-7207af439f4d tc filter show
ubuntu@devstack-master-openvswitch ~ ❯❯❯ sudo ip netns exec qrouter-07c0b25a-4af1-40bf-b1e7-7207af439f4d tc filter show dev qg-a295bdfa-15
filter parent 1: protocol ip pref 1 u32
filter parent 1: protocol ip pref 1 u32 fh 800: ht divisor 1
filter parent 1: protocol ip pref 1 u32 fh 800::800 order 2048 key ht 800 bkt 0 flowid :1
  match 0a0a008b/ffffffff at 12
 police 0x4 rate 1Mbit burst 100Kb mtu 2Kb action drop overhead 0b
ref 1 bind 1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 22:43:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

It might be something on my devstack because in tc it looks that everything is configured properly.
Please just check and confirm me that all works like it should for You and I'm fine with it then :)"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-06 01:01:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I've test it locally, with ovs_use_veth=True/False. Everything works fine. The qos rule was set on the proper device.

I think Lu lei maybe want the router gateway IP rate limit, but he enabled the gateway port qos. So yes, if enable gateway port qos and fip qos, both extension related tc rules will be installed on separated device. So, the minimum value effect.

For instance, if you set gateway port 1Mbps, but set one specific floating IP 10Mbps. The floating IP 10Mbps rules was set in router namespace. The port qos 1Mbps tc rules was set outside the namespace one `ovs tap-device`. So, the minimum value effect, aka floating IP can not reach 10Mbps, because the gateway port qos limit all traffic.

So let's reiterate it, all these qos rules are only set to ensure not exceed max bandwidth. No minimum bandwidth guarantee, this is very essential to know.

I think this is basiclly a user behavior decision. Maybe we should well document it."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-06 02:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Since cloud users has such need for `gateway IP rate limite`. Maybe I can restore https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424468/ and rename it to `[L3][QoS] Router gateway IP rate limit`. So maybe a bp or spec must add first.'}, {'account_id': 22132, 'date': '2017-12-06 02:19:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi, LIU. In my opinion, There are only two cases:
VM got a floatingip or not. If VM get floatingip,
when traffics come out from qg_xxx will do SNAT(
private ip-->VM floatingip).So we can set a fip_qos
in VM floating ip. But if VM is not get a floatingip,
when traffics come out from qg_xxx will do SNAT(
private ip -->router-gateway-floatingip). We can set
a fip_qos in router gateway ip. So we don't need  to set
configuration ovs_use_veth=True/False, even more we don't
need route-gateway-qos by setting port qos any more.
Just my private opinions:)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-06 08:14:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

First of all I think that such discussion about other features should be in some other place than this review :)
Second, patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425218/ already adds possibility to configure qos policy on router gateway (qg) so it's exactly same interface as You are using for confguration of FIP bandwidth limit.
And third thing: this patch works fine IMHO and it is doing what it should. We should focus now on finish this one and write proper documentation. If You will then have ideas how to improve it, You can always open bugs/rfe on launchpad and it can be discussed there.
Is it ok for You?"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:28:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Hi, LIU. In my opinion, There are only two cases:
 > VM got a floatingip or not. If VM get floatingip,
 > when traffics come out from qg_xxx will do SNAT(

 > a fip_qos in router gateway ip. So we don't need  to set
 > configuration ovs_use_veth=True/False, even more we don't
 > need route-gateway-qos by setting port qos any more.
 > Just my private opinions:)

I will start a new RFE or bp for this concern."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 12:58:11.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] L3 agent side floating IP rate limit

This patch implemented the L3 agent side floating IP rate limit.
For all routers, if floating IP has qos rules, the corresponding
TC filters rules will be added to the device of router namespace:
1. for legacy/HA router, the device is qg-device, aka router gateway
   in network node.
2. for dvr/dvr-ha router, the device is rfp-device in compute node.

Partially-Implements blueprint: floating-ip-rate-limit

Change-Id: Ie8a5fe4ebaeccfb3998732dd972663c54542b5bf

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] L3 agent side Floating IP rate limit

This patch implements the L3 agent side floating IP rate limit.
For all routers, if floating IP has qos rules, the corresponding
TC filters will be added to:
1. for legacy/HA router, the device is qg-device of qrouter-namespace,
   aka router gateway in network node.
2. for dvr (HA) router in compute node, the device is rfp-device, the
   namespace is qrouter-namespace.
3. for dvr (HA) router in network node, the device is qg-device in
   snat-namespace.

Partially-Implements blueprint: floating-ip-rate-limit

Change-Id: Ie8a5fe4ebaeccfb3998732dd972663c54542b5bf

subject: Fix up the rabbitmq-ready check
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-21 05:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-21 15:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 05:25:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix up the rabbitmq-ready check

So the current rabbitmq-ready exec has a few unexpected problems:

1) The notify mechanism is not being called, but after discussion
we're comfortable in calling this all the time, just like we do this
for galera.
2) Calling rabbitmqctl inside a container is problematic because
the mere invocation of the cluster_status command will actually
spawn an epmd process which will take the epmd port and which will
subsequently make the rabbitmq-bundle started by pacemaker fail to
form a cluster.

For this reason (working around the rabbitmqctl issue is potentially
doable once we upgrade to erlang 19.x but not with older versions)
it is vital that this container gets spawned with /bin/epmd nooped
to /bin/true.

We now only proceed after rabbit tells us that it is part of a cluster.
Just checking for rabbit being up is not enough because if the user gets
created before the node joins a cluster, it might not be replicated
(depending on the timing).

Partial-Bug: #1739026

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I54c541d86782665ae0f689428a16edc155f87993
Depends-On: Ie74a13a6c8181948900ea0de8ee9717f76f3ce79
(cherry picked from commit 2f33d74173b79117c962146ac2c88fe1e3836403)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up the rabbitmq-ready check

So the current rabbitmq-ready exec has a few unexpected problems:

1) The notify mechanism is not being called, but after discussion
we're comfortable in calling this all the time, just like we do this
for galera.
2) Calling rabbitmqctl inside a container is problematic because
the mere invocation of the cluster_status command will actually
spawn an epmd process which will take the epmd port and which will
subsequently make the rabbitmq-bundle started by pacemaker fail to
form a cluster.

For this reason (working around the rabbitmqctl issue is potentially
doable once we upgrade to erlang 19.x but not with older versions)
it is vital that this container gets spawned with /bin/epmd nooped
to /bin/true.

We now only proceed after rabbit tells us that it is part of a cluster.
Just checking for rabbit being up is not enough because if the user gets
created before the node joins a cluster, it might not be replicated
(depending on the timing).

Partial-Bug: #1739026

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I54c541d86782665ae0f689428a16edc155f87993
Depends-On: Ie74a13a6c8181948900ea0de8ee9717f76f3ce79
(cherry picked from commit 2f33d74173b79117c962146ac2c88fe1e3836403)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 05:20:01.000000000', 'message': "Make sure rabbitmq is fully up before creating any rabbitmq resources

Right now after creating the rabbitmq pacemaker resource, we have no
guarantee that rabbit will be up. Let's add the same mechanism we use
today with the galera-ready exec resource. This gives us the guarantee
that once the resource has been created it is up and we can actually
create rabbitmq users (some 3rd party plugins do that, not stock
TripleO).

Specifically, we probe that the '{rabbit,' app shows up in the status,
so we can guarantee that rabbit is running before invoking any other
rabbitmqctl commands.

Change-Id: Ib37eb2e591f97de54ee6449817ae8d70c6541753
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b2dc580a3f156851018f8524dea72436abf820cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure rabbitmq is fully up before creating any rabbitmq resources

Right now after creating the rabbitmq pacemaker resource, we have no
guarantee that rabbit will be up. Let's add the same mechanism we use
today with the galera-ready exec resource. This gives us the guarantee
that once the resource has been created it is up and we can actually
create rabbitmq users (some 3rd party plugins do that, not stock
TripleO).

Specifically, we probe that the '{rabbit,' app shows up in the status,
so we can guarantee that rabbit is running before invoking any other
rabbitmqctl commands.

Change-Id: Ib37eb2e591f97de54ee6449817ae8d70c6541753
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b2dc580a3f156851018f8524dea72436abf820cc)

commit_message:
Correct typo in manila/share.pp resource chaining

A typo error resulted in an attempted resource chaining of
Ceph::Key[client.manila] to Exec[exec-setfacl-manila-manila]. The
actual exec resource is Exec[exec-setfacl-manila]

Change-Id: I78eec6022211b0e82c06599dea300961a2309f0c
(cherry picked from commit 65d226a925f003e4be6077d60da4c99eb1049a9e)

commit_message:
Add secgroup-rule-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the secgroup-delete-rule command.

The trove command delete is now:
        openstack database secgroup rule delete

Change-Id: I5bff75365db5d97a17dbdce8cba9ac9a08d9cbc3
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: Ia207f4c8d2e6134aed4dbee37ccfb7b7f58bab16
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: Ia207f4c8d2e6134aed4dbee37ccfb7b7f58bab16

commit_message:
Fix to prevent password from being displayed in logs.

During NetScaler driver login, password would be logged at info
level.  This changes the code to remove the password from the logged
message.

Change-Id: I8f5a19a9b51202a1c4bb9852ccdc3271ba479ea6
(cherry picked from commit b8018be8258f1bb1b46db95af4fd33f10eb42a4c)

subject: add the option to disable auto approve for tasks
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-12 05:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-12 05:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When we do the config changes and default stuff later, we need to document the various config stuff properly.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-12 05:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-12 05:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-12 21:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

We do have a configuration.rst file that documents most of the current config, I think as we do not have an example of this in conf.yaml it would be best to add it there before it's merged. (I feel like its the sort of thing that could easily be forgetten about). My other concern, and I don't know the best way to deal with this is that this will not show anywhere on the task when viewed, in the action notes only "Auto Approve set to True." will be shown, so it may be best to add a note when autoapprove is set to true that that has been overriden?'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-12 22:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> We do have a configuration.rst file that documents most of the
 > current config, I think as we do not have an example of this in
 > conf.yaml it would be best to add it there before it's merged. (I
 > feel like its the sort of thing that could easily be forgetten
 > about). My other concern, and I don't know the best way to deal
 > with this is that this will not show anywhere on the task when
 > viewed, in the action notes only "Auto Approve set to True." will
 > be shown, so it may be best to add a note when autoapprove is set
 > to true that that has been overriden?

The problem is that we don't task level notes, although we potentially should. :/

I think adding task level notes as a separate json field on the task model may not be a terrible idea since there are things we log that could potentially be logged to the task notes as well.

The alternative may be to move the checking of this into the actions themselves in the `set_auto_approve` code.

Will play with it when I get back.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-12-21 22:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26263, 'date': '2017-12-22 00:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
add the option to disable auto approve for tasks

* This add a simple config option for tasks that lets a deployer
  selectively disable auto_approve for tasks that normally would
  approve themselves.
* adds a test to confirm this functionality works as expected.
* add a doc note about how to use this feature.

Implements: disable-auto-approve
Change-Id: I3cabd8a39c9ff1d3fc3f4dd8c50a8fa83f031fcf

[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2017-12-15 16:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm a little uncomfortable with the overlap between the eligibility window and the nomination window: what do others think about pushing nomination to 2 feb (really 3) or eligibility back to 1 Feb?"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-15 16:39:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

The overlap is weird, but consistent with what we have done last time. 

I'd rather not reduce the nomination period, so if you want to fix the overlap I would just end eligibility when nominations start."}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-15 23:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2017-12-15 23:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-18 13:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-18 13:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

I'm only +1 because of the smallish gap to generate rolls.  That's often an issue and we're looking at a reasonable amount of code change this cycle so I think erring on the side of caution is right.

Overall looks good to me.  If you haven't already can you do something like I006961073d8d2acebacdd9fcaf4594998f93d798

We probably want to also update the officials list to remove m, but thaty can be a follow-up change"}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2017-12-20 23:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:33:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Latest patch set still looks good for me.  Aligning the email deadline and nomination period ought give enough time to generate rolls (although I might wish the scheduling was over a non-FOSDEM weekend, but that isn't something we can usefully change, given the release cycle)."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-21 09:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-21 19:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 22:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-12-21 23:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Prepare Rocky PTL Election

This patch sets the dates for the election timeline earlier
so that people are more prepared for the election.

Change-Id: Id3ba8f97580911067799331ce2a7b58805c1ae76

and deal with non-user-initiated state changes to shares.

commit_message:
Change ensure share to make startup faster

This driver interface is currently being used wrong and needs a rewrite.
This patch adds the ability to solve the potential problem of slow start
up, and deal with non-user-initiated state changes to shares.

Implement BP ensure-share
Change-Id: I704591446cd5f6ad2293c5a18eccf5412d488baf

commit_message:
Add user system grant policies

This commit introduces new policies that control RBAC for assigning
users roles on the system. Since the management of system roles is a
system-level operation, each policy has `system` set as scope_types.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: Ie606e769427a5ca422997efe92402e712f3cf45f

commit_message:
Propose multi-attach using V3 Attachment API's

This spec proposes support of multi-attached volumes in Cinder.  It does
not deal with how this is supported/implemented on the consumer side,
but only proposes steps to enable it on the Cinder side and suggested
policy additions for a cloud operator to control it's use.

Change-Id: Ib2bfd98106a9edd6f3152e9e3078b9be3f4bbc43

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 13:51:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP fix up the rabbitmq-ready check

So the current rabbitmq-ready exec has a few unexpected problems:

1) Due to a weird puppet behaviour (to be investigated?) the notify
does not work at all (i.e. the exec actually never gets triggered)
2) Calling rabbitmqctl inside a container is problematic because
the mere invocation of the cluster_status command will actually
spawn an epmd process which will take the epmd port and which will
subsequently make the rabbitmq-bundle started by pacemaker fail to
form a cluster.

For this reason (working around the rabbitmqctl issue is potentially
doable once we upgrade to erlang 19.x but not with older versions)
we rely on a check via the CIB to detect if the rabbitmq resource
is actually started.

WIP because:
A) Need to figure out why the notify mechanism is not working
B) Test that it all works as expected

Change-Id: I54c541d86782665ae0f689428a16edc155f87993
Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

So the current rabbitmq-ready exec has a few unexpected problems:

1) The notify mechanism is not being called, but after discussion
we're comfortable in calling this all the time, just like we do this
for galera.
2) Calling rabbitmqctl inside a container is problematic because
the mere invocation of the cluster_status command will actually
spawn an epmd process which will take the epmd port and which will

For this reason (working around the rabbitmqctl issue is potentially
doable once we upgrade to erlang 19.x but not with older versions)
it is vital that this container gets spawned with /bin/epmd nooped
to /bin/true.

We now only proceed after rabbit tells us that it is part of a cluster.
Just checking for rabbit being up is not enough because if the user gets
created before the node joins a cluster, it might not be replicated
(depending on the timing).

commit_message:
Fix up the rabbitmq-ready check

So the current rabbitmq-ready exec has a few unexpected problems:

1) The notify mechanism is not being called, but after discussion
we're comfortable in calling this all the time, just like we do this
for galera.
2) Calling rabbitmqctl inside a container is problematic because
the mere invocation of the cluster_status command will actually
spawn an epmd process which will take the epmd port and which will
subsequently make the rabbitmq-bundle started by pacemaker fail to
form a cluster.

For this reason (working around the rabbitmqctl issue is potentially
doable once we upgrade to erlang 19.x but not with older versions)
it is vital that this container gets spawned with /bin/epmd nooped
to /bin/true.

We now only proceed after rabbit tells us that it is part of a cluster.
Just checking for rabbit being up is not enough because if the user gets
created before the node joins a cluster, it might not be replicated
(depending on the timing).

Partial-Bug: #1739026

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I54c541d86782665ae0f689428a16edc155f87993
Depends-On: Ie74a13a6c8181948900ea0de8ee9717f76f3ce79

subject: Install liberasurecode for CentOS
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27374, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2017-12-21 15:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2017-12-21 23:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

You would think that the reason why this patch does not include PyECLib is that python-pyeclib does not have a -devel package, being in Python. But actually the reason is that PyECLib loads dynamically without regard to soname, and on Fedora and CentOS libraries only available with soname in binary packages. The -devel package provides a soname-less link to "current" or "latest" library. The real fix should be in PyECLib but at this point we're afraid to fix it, because of oddball libraries that operators build from source or obtain otherwise (e.g. ISA-L and HPSS).'}]

commit_message:
Install liberasurecode for CentOS

Since I747c2b8754effbc6ec82af3bf7543fd9599a6c14 we do not install
the RDO package repository anymore and thus liberasurecode-devel cannot
be installed.

Add new script tools/test-setup.sh that is called by OpenStack CI jobs
for tox jobs to set up.

The script enables the RDO repository and install the dependencies
liberasurecode-devel and yasm for CentOS 7 and RHEL 7.

Change-Id: I3cb3dc14848a72fe9f93ee8dacab65f1714e1838

commit_message:
Fix share can not be found by name in admin context

Currently, when using admin context to execute 'manila
show <share-name>' to show a share detail which is not
owned by admin, it always fails with 'No share with a
name or ID of <share-name> exists'. This patch will fix
it.

Change-Id: I96339778fa69c379863078250d5dfa7172f2c1b2
Closes-Bug: #1721787
(cherry picked from commit b9ebff14caddf42b629ba00bc9ea52ac2b39117b)

[{'created': '2017-12-12 13:57:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP DNR Wait for rabbitmq_ready tag

We need to wait for rabbitmq_ready exec so that rabbit is fully
up. This can only happen if we add the tag for it.

Change-Id: Ie74a13a6c8181948900ea0de8ee9717f76f3ce79
Depends-On: I54c541d86782665ae0f689428a16edc155f87993
'}, {'created': '2017-12-15 16:59:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP DNR Wait for rabbitmq_ready tag

We need to wait for rabbitmq_ready exec so that rabbit is fully
up. This can only happen if we add the tag for it.
Also we need to make sure that launching epmd process cannot
happen. The reason for this is the following:
When the puppet-rabbitmq module gets invoked inside the
rabbitmq_init_bundle container it spawns an epmd process.
Now if we wait for the Exec[rabbitmq-ready], it means that this
epmd process is staying around until rabbit is up, but then
will disappear suddenly when the rabbitmq_init_bundle container
exits, which will subsequently confuse the rabbitmq cluster and
make it fail.

WIP as I need to test this more throughly

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Wait for rabbitmq_ready tag

We need to wait for rabbitmq_ready exec so that rabbit is fully
up. This can only happen if we add the tag for it.
Also we need to make sure that launching the epmd process cannot
happen. The reason for this is the following:
When the puppet-rabbitmq module gets invoked (a simple facter run
will be sufficient) inside the rabbitmq_init_bundle container it spawns
an epmd process.
Now if we wait for the Exec[rabbitmq-ready], it means that this epmd
process is staying around until rabbit is up, but then will disappear
suddenly when the rabbitmq_init_bundle container exits, which will
subsequently confuse the rabbitmq cluster and make it fail.

Partial-Bug: #1739026

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie74a13a6c8181948900ea0de8ee9717f76f3ce79

commit_message:
Use generic netcat syntax in base scenario

Current syntax only works with busybox netcat, directly call the script
after making it executable so it works with all versions of netcat (and
all base test images)

Change-Id: I398ab7147faf9487f157930c5bf4da0448f96527
(cherry picked from commit 0846005e8d1bbbd95eafe4c56244400a3d53a006)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 19:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add fallback logic to _get_interface_ip()

This commit adds a fallback condition for the _get_interface_ip()
function. The idea of the interface_ip is to have an address end users
can rely on for interfacing with their server. But all of the logic
makes some assumptions or depends on preconfiguration via
os-client-config. There are cases where this doesn't work (or
the pre-configuration isn't done) and when that happens the current
default behavior is to use public_v4. However, that assumes public_v4 is
defined. If it's not the interface_ip field is just an empty string.
This makes it hard to depend on the interface_ip field if it can be
undefined.

This commit adjusts the final fallback behavior to just call
get_server_ip() so if we don't have any interface to use we just get an
address we can reach. (or the only address) This way we always have an
interface_ip set that "works".

Change-Id: I32834c726119fc1dae5ca74b00825c8f52716f2c
'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 16:59:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add fallback logic to _get_interface_ip()

This commit adds a fallback condition for the _get_interface_ip()
function. The idea of the interface_ip is to have an address end users
can rely on for interfacing with their server. But all of the logic
makes some assumptions or depends on preconfiguration via
os-client-config. There are cases where this doesn't work (or
the pre-configuration isn't done) and when that happens the current
default behavior is to use public_v4. However, that assumes public_v4 is
defined. If it's not the interface_ip field is just an empty string.
This makes it hard to depend on the interface_ip field if it can be
undefined.

This commit adjusts the final fallback behavior to just call
get_server_ip() so if we don't have any interface to use we just get an
address we can reach. This way we always have an interface_ip set, if one
is available, that just "works".

Change-Id: I32834c726119fc1dae5ca74b00825c8f52716f2c
'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 20:25:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add fallback logic to _get_interface_ip()

default behavior is to use public_v4. However, that assumes public_v4 is
defined. If it's not the interface_ip field is just an empty string.
This makes it hard to depend on the interface_ip field if it can be
undefined.

This commit adjusts the final fallback behavior to just call

commit_message:
Add fallback logic to _get_interface_ip()

This commit adds a fallback condition for the _get_interface_ip()
function. The idea of the interface_ip is to have an address end users
can rely on for interfacing with their server. But all of the logic
makes some assumptions or depends on preconfiguration via
os-client-config. There are cases where this doesn't work (or
the pre-configuration isn't done) and when that happens the current
default behavior is to use public_v4. However, that assumes public_v4 is
defined. If it's not the interface_ip field is just an empty string.
This makes it hard to depend on the interface_ip field if it can be
undefined.

This commit adjusts the final fallback behavior to just call
get_server_ip() so if we don't have any interface to use we just get an
address we can reach. This way we always have an interface_ip set, if one
is available, that just "works".

Change-Id: I32834c726119fc1dae5ca74b00825c8f52716f2c

commit_message:
Implement manager logic for group+system roles

This change implements all the manager APIs to grant roles to groups
at a system level. A subsequent patch will:

  - wire up the controllers and expose the assignment API publicly
  - return system roles when asking for user and group assignments

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I681023995ac2a605669a575abd43aac11e1ae012

messages:
[{'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2017-11-07 21:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-11-07 22:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have a concern that this is backwards-incompatible with the current stable charms (https://github.com/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/blob/stable/17.08/actions/replace_osd.py).  

Also for full context, before we can fully review this library change, we'll need to see the proposed implementation in corresponding ceph-* charms.

Please be sure to use the same branch/topic for those to group the changes into a logical set.

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The noted recent merges conflict with this change.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 21:01:14.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor utils/replace_osd function, add tests

Monolithic replace_osd function will only work where mon and osds
coexist on the same metal.  This change breaks that function into
several logically distinct functions which can be used in hooks or
actions independently of each other.

Change-Id: Id421cccce67ea33dfb8307b455bc2f00d0e05795
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor utils/replace_osd function, add tests

Monolithic replace_osd function will only work where mon and osds
coexist on the same metal.  This change breaks that function into
several logically distinct functions which can be used in hooks or
actions independently of each other.

Change-Id: Id421cccce67ea33dfb8307b455bc2f00d0e05795

commit_message:
Implement manager logic for user+system roles

This change implements all the manager APIs to grant roles to users
at a system level. A subsequent patch will do the same thing for
groups and hook everything up to the controllers.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I49b43693410273ae8c7fa275ce0d827708ece535

commit_message:
Add user-create to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the user-create command.

The trove command user-create is now:
    openstack database user create

Change-Id: I325b87225260ed19b787b99e6190503b66f5949c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

subject: Fix python-blazarclient ACLs
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is this needed and why are the blazar ACLs itself not ok?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looks like I didn't do it right, and I probably have it wrong. But we found that the blazar team has been pushing their own tags to the python-blazarclient repo, so this was my attempt to fix that so they couldn't.

Any advice where that should actually be controlled?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

right now they can tag both blazar and python-blazarclient.

Should they be able to do *both* - or only blazar - or none?

blazar.config has:
[access "refs/tags/*"]
pushSignedTag = group blazar-release

remove that and they cannot tag either.

If you really want to split it, then your approach is the right one - but update the commit message to make clear what you want.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-21 21:33:36.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ah, perfect. That's what I wanted. New patch coming."}]

commit_message:
Update to support new attachment API mv 3.44

Currently, attempts to use local-attach with the newest
attachment API microversion, 3.44, results in the attchment
hanging at 'attaching'.  This is because brick-cinderclient-ext
was not updated to use the 'attachment.complete(attachment_id)
step when attaching.

This adds this call so that the attachment will complete.

Change-Id: I19983e3e38771da87b8471673a15daf59dc5f25f
closes-bug:  1739653

[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-12-13 05:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-12-13 17:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-12-14 20:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-12-14 23:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2017-12-15 06:07:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Make a response for Tim. I'm not sure if Tim mind that, so no score for now. If he is ok, I'll turn my score +2 expecting we will work to make more strict assertion in another patch."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-12-15 12:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

With allow_object_versioning = false these tests Error rather than Skip. I think it would be better to refactor the tests into the existing TestObjectVersioning to re-use all the setup and skip logic there. That also has the benefit of the subclasses running the tests so that (with a little massaging) we get coverage for history mode too.

See my gist [1] for the refactor - bigger change than I felt comfortable to just push over this.

There's another existing test with the same problem [2]

[1] https://gist.github.com/alistairncoles/8418900befd48d554cf5b2d979c0d8a6
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1738401

======================================================================
ERROR: test_copy_destination_restore_symlink (test.functional.test_versioned_writes.TestSymlinkWithVersioning)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):

commit_message:
Add project tags to keystoneclient

Adds the client functionality for the following project tag calls:
- Create a project tag on a project
- Check if a project tag exists on a project
- List project tags on a project
- Modify project tags on a project
- Delete a specific project tag on a project
- Delete all project tags on a project

Co-Authored-By: Jess Egler <jess.egler@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rohan Arora <ra271w@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Partially Implements: bp project-tags

Change-Id: I486b2969ae0aa2638842d842fb8b0955cc086d25

commit_message:
Pass mountpoint to volume attachment_create with connector

Similar to I11ba269c3f7a2e7707b2b7e27d26eb7a2c948a82, when
we create a volume attachment with a connector, we need to
also provide the mountpoint via the connector to Cinder,
because internally within Cinder the attachment_create code
is calling attachment_update if a connector is provided.

Change-Id: If3afe8d8bd6b8c327ccc7d1140053bccaf7e1ad7
Closes-Bug: #1737779

commit_message:
Implement backend logic for system roles

Introduce the plumbing so that we can store system role assignments.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: If9f56e4568fa528f201030edabdf30ac6961682e

commit_message:
[import-tests] adds tests for image-import/staging

Currently there are no tests available for staging
during image import. This connects to the blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/image-import-refactor

etherpad (discussion):
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-image-import-tests

Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I4d4b75b8952f57abdf1b1c03d6395d6ca96ea345

commit_message:
VMware: implement get_inventory() driver method

Implementing the get_inventory() method allow us to report the
aggregated capacity for cpu, disk and memory. The max_unit property for
cpu and memory is set to the maximum vCPU and memory available from
single ESX host. The max_unit property for disk is set to the maximum
free space available on a single datastore.

Change-Id: I7324bae93e5fbb1301c76466575a906434ca5376
Closes-Bug: #1462957

commit_message:
VMware: expose max vCPUs and max memory per ESX host

Expose maximum vCPUs and maximum memory from single ESX host in the
vCenter cluster. This will be used for implementing get_inventory() in
the follow up patch.

Partial-Bug: #1462957

Change-Id: I28e19d46a737ac253718c7c66837bd71b064b0b9
