revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 03:49:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I084faaa76e8a7a6f9f1866fa0a040357fc4f00f2

values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Also, fix branch instruction for releasenotes.

Change-Id: I084faaa76e8a7a6f9f1866fa0a040357fc4f00f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 08:35:17.000000000', 'message': 'translations: Fix nodejs install

We're not using local install yet, so make the nodejs function handle
running in a venv.

Currently it fails with:
"Can not perform a '--user' install. User site-packages are not visible
in this virtualenv."

Change-Id: I7a62a6fb236286c967fe2fbfb0266e016d3dcecf
'}]
commit_message:
translations: Fix nodejs install

We're not using local install yet, so make the nodejs function handle
running in a venv.

Currently it fails with:
"Can not perform a '--user' install. User site-packages are not visible
in this virtualenv."

Change-Id: I7a62a6fb236286c967fe2fbfb0266e016d3dcecf

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for '--remove-from-date'

This adds a series of new integration tests to verify the behavior of
'--remove-from-date' in combination with several other flags,
including '--no-incremental', '--always-level', and '--max-level'.

Change-Id: I03fc8487934e0118db5a1f7044e880fc8121702a

commit_message:
Don't specify a path for the freezer cli in tests.

This helps making the tests more compatible accross
different platforms. Instead of a fixed path, the
PATH environment variable will be used.

Change-Id: Ia3c9536c12834b0487aae07b1df975673cbd6d80

commit_message:
Update HPE copyright

HPE commiters forgot to update the copyright to 2016.
Doing that for all files modified by an HPE employee since January 2016.

Change-Id: I0d08eded9b9f8ec5dfb910b26aa852d86d59906f

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2017-09-06 14:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Adding PostgreSQL support

This adds support for a PostgreSQL backup. It makes use of the
CHECKPOINT feature. The agent is invoked similarly to the MySQL
backup mode.

Change-Id: I90a2e72034872123df263ade9afddb0a8c19d6a7

commit_message:
Replace .testr.conf with .stestr.conf

In this change [1] os_testr changed under the covers from using
testr to stestr, so that we now get the following warning:

 ostestr.py:120:
 UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD.
 Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a
 script to do this in the stestr git repository.

So remove the .testr.conf and add .stestr.conf which was
generated using a utility script as documented here [2].

[1] Id7cb2a39a8308f1413608dcf19273a1d7f33592e
[2] https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/stestr/stable/stestr.pdf

Change-Id: I64e2ad475606d42eeb1c232f0a8e3a37989661bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-25 13:58:05.000000000', 'message': 'Check PATH only once for trickle

Change to check for trickle executable using the PATH environment
variable only once, since default of path=None will get the PATH
variable behind the scenes anyway.

Replace nested if statements with a simple loop for easier addition of
paths to include in search in future.

Ensure os.pathsep is used as specified in the documentation for
find_executable.

Change-Id: Ibc4f33499f61d91c671efe36a2f996ee71d48554
'}]
commit_message:
Check PATH only once for trickle

Change to check for trickle executable using the PATH environment
variable only once, since default of path=None will get the PATH
variable behind the scenes anyway.

Replace nested if statements with a simple loop for easier addition of
paths to include in search in future.

Ensure os.pathsep is used as specified in the documentation for
find_executable.

Change-Id: Ibc4f33499f61d91c671efe36a2f996ee71d48554

commit_message:
Initial commit for openstack-client support in python-freezerclient

This patch enables openstack-client support in python-freezerclient
by setting entry points and implementing two interface functions

Partially implements: blueprint openstack-client-support-in-python-freezerclient

Change-Id: I286893c9f5fec727ab404c85cdcb875d993a8b71

when passing arguments

[{'created': '2017-03-28 06:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

As of now, UUID is being generated using either uuid.uuid4()
or uuidutils.generate_uuid(). In order to maintain consistency,
we propose to use uuidutils.generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.

Closes-bug: #1082248

Change-Id: Ie9f60d7387207a3a67eb58f7b844ace3815a0976
Closes-bug: #1082248
'}]
commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

As of now, UUID is being generated using either uuid.uuid4()
or uuidutils.generate_uuid(). In order to maintain consistency,
we propose to use uuidutils.generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.

Change-Id: Ie9f60d7387207a3a67eb58f7b844ace3815a0976
Closes-bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Better installation instructions

This fix contains lots of installation instructions and fixed. I have
personally confirmed that earlier installation instructions does lack
lots of importent points. Because I have stuck bunch of times just
because there is not enough or correct information.

Change-Id: Ia9170e2ad39f85993fab6205684a2d6b8a489390

Update HPE copyright

HPE commiters forgot to update the copyright to 2016.
Doing that for all files modified by an HPE employee since January 2016.

commit_message:
Implement migrations and config opts for oslo.db

Database can be created and all the tables
migrated to latest versions using
freezer-manage db sync command.
Introduced state_path configuration option which
is used as a physical path to database.
Introduced sql group in config file which should
contain all the oslo.db backend-related parameters,
such as connection for database.

Implements: blueprint oslo-db

Change-Id: I194860a2f9efa3e6ce552351993257f1aedb54a4

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed). If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit
Tests fail. The following patch fixes this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0367b09d81c6208871aa19ead9dcc3caea940c82

commit_message:
Changed the home-page of freezer-web-ui in setup.cfg

Instead of pointing to https://github.com/openstack/freezer-web-ui,
the homepage has been changed to point to the homepage of
freezer-web-ui.

Change-Id: Ia778ee71a4c43135ccb044ad1776a97373dcd47b

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Update freezer web-ui README.rst

delete "cd freezer-web-ui"

add "sudo pip install -e freezer-web-ui" in "Production Installation"

Doing that for all files modified by an HPE employee since January 2016.

commit_message:
Action name is required in action create form

In action create from, choose "Admin" in "Action" field, then
"Action Name" is hidden, but actually it is required. Now I fix
it.

Change-Id: I9631382f4040b9359c5d42719ef9b046c402df0f
Closes-bug: #1703590

commit_message:
Migrate special docs jobs to build-openstack-sphinx-docs

The api-ref, api-guide, deploy-guide, install-guide and
placement-api-ref docs all are just sphinx docs. Update jobs to use the
sphinx base job.

Update relevant files list to include the requirements files used.

Change-Id: I02e882786677f279c89614c2f5d295153e489a36

commit_message:
Add the cindernative backup creation to freezer web

Now the freezer has supported the cindernative backup creation,
so this patch add the cindernative backup creation to the
'Create Action' form in the freezer web.

Change-Id: I74d15a5613b48a127c2b8233035c5eeb4c6763fd

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-10 02:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Disable vexxhost due to job timeouts

We seem to have a lot of jobs being slow enough to hit timeouts when
running on vexxhost, disable them for now.

Change-Id: I87d7f17840ce52904fb87c4c74ea153952aa3e7f

messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-10 22:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-11 06:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

why does searchlight-ui need specific npm jobs? We should be able to use the standard jobs instead - and those can stay in project-config. Let's try using the standard jobs.

For that: First check here locally that the standard jobs work and then update the project-config change to use them."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-13 14:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Just wanted to get the jobs over here so we can deal with them, but Andreas is right, might as well fix them at the same time.  Will give it a shot when some time opens up.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-17 14:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-17 17:42:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

There are no *legacy* jobs anymore to convert, we use standard v3 native jobs in project-config and since those are the PTI mandated ones, let's leave them there.

I really see no reason for this at all anymore, I suggest to abandon."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-21 13:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Migrate legacy jobs to project repository

See the "Legacy Job Migration Details" section of
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html

This patch moves the legacy jobs to the searchlight-ui repo where
they are redefined to use standard pre-defined zuul3 jobs.

Needed-By: I9ddcf0c5b3527b99d37fde6baedc2376db133030
Needed-By: Ia18194897380612c6b6e209218f31c10e0b37c90
Change-Id: I892614de255c1a6aee3304beafc728ac72100f4c

Hi Aseel,

Thanks for proposing this fix.

As it is an old bug we need to look into the current code. We have a new attach/detach API in Cinder and it is a question whether the condition is still applicable to the new API as well and if not how to handle the two cases.

Thanks,
Ildikó'}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Aseel,

Thanks for your patch.

By looking into the code I found that this issue is already fixed, please see my comment in line. I will make sure that the bug report is closed as well.

Thanks,
Ildikó'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-12-13 04:32:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Yeah, this was a duplicate of https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1484194

I'm not sure why it didn't get closed/released status with the relationship there, maybe LP doesn't do that and I never noticed?

Anyway, thank you for working it up, sorry that it's already been addressed though."}, {'account_id': 26907, 'date': '2017-12-21 13:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add volume status check to api detach method

Check if the volume is attached before firing odd the RPC call.

Change-Id: I93bedb23fc0f4dc466fd34f2c56a72246d1df218
Closes-Bug: 1445247

commit_message:
Pass bdms to versioned notifications during finish_revert_resize

Now that we have bdms in scope, we can pass those to the
notify_about_instance_action method so it doesn't have to
look up bdms again from the database.

Change-Id: I38008a886f224372949f7c46892d472a3b3aabc3

commit_message:
jsonutils.to_primitive(): add fallback parameter

For example, to_primitive(fallback=repr) can be used to prevent
serialialization error like "ValueError: Circular reference detected"
when using the JSONFormatter of oslo.log.

If fallback is set, it is also used to convert itertools.count(),
"nasty" objects like types, and to handle TypeError.

Use fallback=six.text_type to convert objects to text.

This patch doesn't change the default behaviour.

Related-Bug: #1593641
Change-Id: Ie0f7f2d09355c3d2a9f7c5ee8f7e02dfea3b073b
(cherry picked from commit cdb2f60d26e3b65b6370f87b2e9864045651c117)

While compute starts it will init all instances, if a
NovaException is raised from one instance during plug_vifs,
then the compute process exits unexpectedly because of this
unhandled exception.
This commit catches the NovaException during init host,
and adds exception info to the instance as fault message.

Closes-Bug: #1738373

commit_message:
compute: Catch binding failed exception while init host

While compute starts it will init all instances, if a
NovaException is raised from one instance during plug_vifs,
then the compute process exits unexpectedly because of this
unhandled exception.
This commit catches the NovaException during init host,
and adds exception info to the instance as fault message.
With this change the compute process can be started normally
even if this NovaException is raised.

Change-Id: I59b0f775139ea2d8a8096b99ab770b517607bc18
Closes-Bug: #1738373

commit_message:
Remove redundant gate config in scenario tests

Each scenario test's config has set BGP_SCHEDULER_DRIVER but
it's also defined in gate_hook.sh and it's applied to each scenario test.
It's redundant that we set such duplicated config to devstack config.
This patch removes the config from scenario tests.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I4f7de61b389180d88cc983b07d027a4deb7a2978

commit_message:
Cleanup migration files

At the moment, if an instance migration/resize fails and is deleted
while being in error state, the instance revert files are not deleted.

This change fixes this issue, ensuring that instance migration files
are cleaned up when an instance is destroyed.

Closes-Bug: #1724240

Change-Id: I3752e7d0bd96a7d418563afd997739e88a87914d

[{'created': '2017-12-19 12:13:38.000000000', 'message': "Add driver methods checking for shared storage

The driver interface provides public methods that determine if two
compute nodes use shared storage.

Although we already use a similar mechanism, we do not implement
those public driver methods, for which reason the compute manager
will wrongfully assume that shared storage is never used.

This is not an issue at the moment, as this mechanism is used by
the manager only cleaning up evacuated instances (which we do not
currently support) and when reverting migrations (in which case
we already have a copy of the instance files in the 'revert dir').

This will become an issue though if we intend to start cleaning up
migration files when destroying instances.

This change adds the above mentioned public driver methods.

Related-Bug: #1724240

Change-Id: I790b39672fd8ffe467fc9d93daf7b38b26103d5d

commit_message:
Add driver methods checking for shared storage

The driver interface provides public methods that determine if two
compute nodes use shared storage.

Although we already use a similar mechanism, we do not implement
those public driver methods, for which reason the compute manager
will wrongfully assume that shared storage is never used.

This is not an issue at the moment, as this mechanism is used by
the manager only when cleaning up evacuated instances (which we
do not currently support) and when reverting migrations (in which
case we already have a copy of the instance files in the 'revert
dir').

This will become an issue though if we intend to start cleaning up
migration files when destroying instances.

This change adds the above mentioned public driver methods.

Related-Bug: #1724240

Change-Id: I790b39672fd8ffe467fc9d93daf7b38b26103d5d

If so, please remove the test's "skip" decorator. If not , the patch is OK for me.'}, {'account_id': 22484, 'date': '2017-12-21 07:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

> I suppose that this patch is trying to fix the error
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529205/1/zaqar/tests/unit/storage/base.py
 > Right?
 > If so, please remove the test's "skip" decorator. If not , the
 > patch is OK for me.

In pymongo 3.6 and above versions, insert api is deprecated and insert_many api doesn't support period in key.
This test is specifically used for testing period, so this test needs to be deleted.'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2017-12-21 08:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8846, 'date': '2017-12-21 08:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks'}]

Add missing dependency

subunit-trace is not in the virtualenv and no more present into the gate
image.

This change installs it into the virtualenv.

commit_message:
Actually add the yaml_dump expression

The previous patch didn't actually add the yaml_dump expression. It just
created the function. This actually loads it.

Change-Id: I29eff8bbbd78a831bca636fc081d6423b381f162

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Adding httpd-worker apache process on SLES

The apache2 process on SLES might be 'httpd-worker'. Otherwise
while running monasca-setup, the error is:
     ERROR: Apache process does not exist.

Change-Id: I27c757b9c3c3b93db7b3edd8e576147e94c32a4a

commit_message:
Modify log message in debug_ssh

In debug_ssh, if the raised exception is not instance of
tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHTimeout, then it maybe the instance
of exceptions.TimeoutException or exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed,
which both indicate command executing error, but the log message
will display "Initializing SSH connection to %(ip)s failed." which
is not accurate. This is to change the log info to
"Executing command on %(ip)s failed."

Change-Id: I8f081e856231a609a32621240f3c6c22aa74c74e

commit_message:
Remove Cinder from tempest gates

In a bit pathetic attempt to reduce number of Tempest (especially
Octavia) jobs timing out, this commit removes installation of Cinder to
save some precious minutes of running time.

Cinder is unused in the Tempest jobs, so it's removal should be safe.

Change-Id: Ia75e924039aac423a49fe2e69555c28b5e273419

commit_message:
Do not use puppet-ceph on newton

environments/puppet-ceph.yaml has been added via Iefd7056a9bc079025e6ac4dd50edcd2e2635e1b0
which is present in ocata and onwards. Let's not use it on Newton.

Change-Id: Ib4c58513bb6017afc19c22e7898c608bbb4f599e
Closes-Bug: #1739357

For the record, this change does not even depend on it, only the last patch from the chain.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2017-12-21 09:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 14:59:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance disk resize issues

This change provides the following instance disk resize fixes:

- removed ephemeral disks are detached during the resize process,
currently this step is skipped, for which reason the planned vms
cannot be *realized*.

- when resizing from a flavor with no ephemeral storage to a new
one that does have ephemeral storage, no ephemeral disk is currently
added as there is no explicit ephemeral BDM. This is inconsistent
with the Libvirt driver behavior as well as Hyper-V driver behavior
prior to the new BDM format addition. This change ensures that we're
adding an ephemeral disk in such situations.

- If the new flavor does not provide ephemeral storage, all ephemeral
disks are removed.

- We're now validating the new flavor ephemeral storage size before
performing the resize/migration, thus failing early in case of an
invalid flavor, also avoiding error state instances.

- We're no longer erroring out if the new flavor's root disk size
is smaller than the current one and the instance was booted from a
volume.

Closes-Bug: 1724240

Change-Id: I296afc9bd947021fcca9199f6aca95ab51cd7df9
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 15:47:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance disk resize issues

Closes-Bug: 1724240

Change-Id: I296afc9bd947021fcca9199f6aca95ab51cd7df9

- We're now validating the new flavor ephemeral storage size before
performing the resize/migration, thus failing early in case of an
invalid flavor, also avoiding error state instances.

- We're no longer erroring out if the new flavor's root disk size
is smaller than the current one and the instance was booted from a
volume.

Closes-Bug: 1724240

Change-Id: I296afc9bd947021fcca9199f6aca95ab51cd7df9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance disk resize issues

This change provides the following instance disk resize fixes:

- removed ephemeral disks are detached during the resize process,
currently this step is skipped, for which reason the planned vms
cannot be *realized*.

- when resizing from a flavor with no ephemeral storage to a new
one that does have ephemeral storage, no ephemeral disk is currently
added as there is no explicit ephemeral BDM. This is inconsistent
with the Libvirt driver behavior as well as Hyper-V driver behavior
prior to the new BDM format addition. This change ensures that we're
adding an ephemeral disk in such situations.

- If the new flavor does not provide ephemeral storage, all ephemeral
disks are removed.

- We're now validating the new flavor ephemeral storage size before
performing the resize/migration, thus failing early in case of an
invalid flavor, also avoiding error state instances.

- We're no longer erroring out if the new flavor's root disk size
is smaller than the current one and the instance was booted from a
volume.

Closes-Bug: 1724240

Change-Id: I296afc9bd947021fcca9199f6aca95ab51cd7df9

commit_message:
Fix upgrades from older charm versions

Ensure that netaddr and netifaces are installed on upgrade from
older py2 based charms to the newer py3 based execution.

Change-Id: I1c7b2eb545e5ef5b40ab2db5a1a968ceb7d916e1
Closes-Bug: 1738979
(cherry picked from commit 023b086b0df9752e42ca311a32148b83515e5bd7)

[{'created': '2017-12-21 04:43:45.000000000', 'message': 'Use ID instead of Name in secgroup_delete_rule

In trove secgroup_delete_rule help message, the parameters
<security_group_rule> is described "Name of security group rule".
In fact, security group rule has not attribute 'name', it only has
'id'.
Users could use trove secgroup-list-rules to get all ID of rules.

Change-Id: If5b97f744b24838e6aa61f4c96608da569886dd2
'}]
commit_message:
Use ID instead of Name in secgroup_delete_rule

In trove secgroup_delete_rule help message, the parameters
<security_group_rule> is described "Name of security group rule".
In fact, security group rule has not attribute 'name', it only has
'id'.
Users could use trove secgroup-list-rules to get all ID of rules.

Change-Id: If5b97f744b24838e6aa61f4c96608da569886dd2

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Thanks for your comments :)'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2017-10-30 08:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Published edit on patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 10487, 'date': '2017-10-30 14:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1

Dear Tackers,

I would like to understand the rational behind recent tacker specs. Recently k8s is approved to be an VIM in Tacker, though magnum would be the choice to be align with OpenStack for container. 
And in this spec, i see zabbix is being asked to support for monitoring, which is not an OpenStack service. 

so is tacker being planned to support not only OpenStack but also non-OpenStack services ? Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2017-10-30 23:36:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Hello Kanagaraj Manickam
Thanks for the comment.

In my personal opinion, it is difficult to judge tacker's future plans simply by this specification. Openstack, on the other hand, provides users with stability in the cloud environment and a wider choice of features. It is important to manage not only the monitoring of the infrastructure in which VNF operates, but also the software functions. Monitoring at the application level as well as at the infrastructure level is also important.

To do this, we should not rule out integration with third-party open source projects as well as openstack projects. One example is the vitrage  of Openstack, OpenBaton, and OPNFV Doctor presenting the situation for various monitoring tools (Zabbix, Nagios, Ceilometer)

In future proposals, my personal plan will be to think of projects in openstack primarily to provide Tacker with many functions as MANO, and also to think about third-party projects depending on the situation.

Thanks :)"}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2017-10-31 01:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> Dear Tackers,
 > 
 > I would like to understand the rational behind recent tacker specs.
 > Recently k8s is approved to be an VIM in Tacker, though magnum
 > would be the choice to be align with OpenStack for container.
 > And in this spec, i see zabbix is being asked to support for
 > monitoring, which is not an OpenStack service.
 > 
 > so is tacker being planned to support not only OpenStack but also
 > non-OpenStack services ? Thank you.

I saw Tacker had plan to support other VIMs like AWS, VMware, and also Kubernetes. I think it is current trend now.'}, {'account_id': 19999, 'date': '2017-10-31 02:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1

Good to go, i guess.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2017-10-31 02:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
Zabbix Plugin for Application Monitoring in Tacker VNF Manager

Develop a Zabbix plugin in Tacker VNF manager to monitor application level
parameters that can't be supported by current Tacker monitoring driver.

Change-Id: Id9bef93a6bff2434a68556c895fe50aec3c1e2ce
Blueprint: zabbix-plugin

[{'created': '2017-12-20 09:26:03.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

For this, move bandit to test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: If1ca9278e104c519a1aff88ed9ff27e120e34aff

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

For this, move bandit to test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: If1ca9278e104c519a1aff88ed9ff27e120e34aff

commit_message:
Bump OVS version to 2.8.1 in upper-constraints

With recent changes in networking-ovn, we're requiring OVS >= 2.8.0
to support both metadata service and L3 HA. Latest available version
in pypi for ovs is 2.8.1 right now.

Change-Id: I5db9a407ea74b0522384ae86ae97c618bd548ad2

commit_message:
monasca-ui: add drilldown subpackage

monasca-ui comes with a scripted Grafana dashboard for Grafana
2.x and higher that can be used for alarm drilldown links.
This commit adds the grafana-monasca-drilldown subpackage that
installs this scripted dashboard into Grafana's dashboard
directory.

Change-Id: I66361d3d6009311964f4183de7cda7dcf7872292

[{'created': '2017-12-18 05:38:14.000000000', 'message': '[placement] Separate API schemas (allocation)

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)
from nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation.py.

Change-Id: I253a9a86bcda97c8697e6e14a4a095751a4128d0
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] Separate API schemas (allocation)

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)
from nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation.py.

Change-Id: I253a9a86bcda97c8697e6e14a4a095751a4128d0

commit_message:
Support delete and cluster_delete with many resources

Not like nova-delete when use trove-delete there is only support
delete an instance everytime. With this patch, we can delete
many instances or clusters in the same call, like
trove delete instance1 instance2.

Change-Id: I6bb0c406ba7f4c0e43cddfdff1d156b7e82ffa7a

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This replaces the deprecated (in python 3.2) unittest.TestCase
method assertRaisesRegexp() with assertRaisesRegex()

Added hacking rule 'assert_raises_regexp'

Change-Id: Ie427bfd5af8474119a9e20cc025cd28abfa42cc2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 21:27:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Implement set_and_clear_allocations in report client

set_and_clear_allocations is added to the scheduler's report client to
provide an atomic method which can set and clear allocations for two
different consumer uuids by making a POST to /allocations. If
microversion 1.13 is not available then it falls back to calling
put_allocations and delete_allocation_for_instance.

Three FIXMEs left behind when dansmith was doing the migration.uuid
with allocations work earlier in blueprint migration-allocations have
been changed from using those two fallback methods to using the
new one.

Missing from this are (at least) unit tests for the report client
change, and there is a test in the wrong place, as noted in the
comments.

Also there are some concerns about the return values from the
methods. Are we doing enough with them?

Are there other places where this change should happen that I missed?

Is the new method too specific? Should it be more generic about
assembling aribtrary allocations that it is given?

Change-Id: I88aa32a95ea64ab7a9214772fd6e2a80c185d0cd
"}, {'created': '2017-12-17 22:47:28.000000000', 'message': "Implement set_and_clear_allocations in report client

have committed to using microversion 1.14 we do not try falling back
to an earlier version as the necessary functionality is provided in
microversion 1.13.

Three FIXMEs left behind when dansmith was doing the migration.uuid
with allocations work earlier in blueprint migration-allocations have
been changed from using those two fallback methods to using the
new one.

Also there are some concerns about the return values from the
methods. Are we doing enough with them?

Are there other places where this change should happen that I missed?

Is the new method too specific? Should it be more generic about
assembling aribtrary allocations that it is given?

Change-Id: I88aa32a95ea64ab7a9214772fd6e2a80c185d0cd
"}]
commit_message:
Implement set_and_clear_allocations in report client

set_and_clear_allocations is added to the scheduler's report client to
provide an atomic method which can set and clear allocations for two
different consumer uuids by making a POST to /allocations. Because we
have committed to using microversion 1.14 we do not try falling back
to an earlier version as the necessary functionality is provided in
microversion 1.13.

Three FIXMEs left behind when dansmith was doing the migration.uuid
with allocations work earlier in blueprint migration-allocations have
been changed from using those two fallback methods to using the
new one.

Also there are some concerns about the return values from the
methods. Are we doing enough with them?

Are there other places where this change should happen that I missed?

Is the new method too specific? Should it be more generic about
assembling aribtrary allocations that it is given?

Change-Id: I88aa32a95ea64ab7a9214772fd6e2a80c185d0cd

[{'created': '2017-12-19 23:42:26.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Workaround missing RequestSpec.project_id when moving an instance

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old

commit_message:
Workaround missing RequestSpec.project_id when moving an instance

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances used an admin context which has an empty project_id,
so when scheduling (moving) one of these, if we try to PUT /allocations
in placement using the FilterScheduler we'll fail because the project_id
is None.

This works around that by putting the instance.project_id on the request
spec before calling the scheduler to pick a node and claim resources
against it.

A later change will need to add some sort of online data migration
routine so that we properly update and persist the fix for these
older records.

Change-Id: I34b1d99a9d0d2aca80f094a79ec1656abaf762dc
Partial-Bug: #1739318

commit_message:
Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances is using an admin context, which doesn't have a project_id
set, which means the request spec that gets created doesn't have
a project_id set, which matters when the FilterScheduler tries to
claim resources (create allocations in Placement) using said
request spec's project_id (PUT /allocations requires a non-null
project_id).

This fixes the online data migration by creating the request spec
using the instance's project_id rather than that from the context.

Change-Id: I214a44f0eee7d90be5cd89f32f6e0017b19a3fd6
Partial-Bug: #1739318

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-29 17:36:00.000000000', 'message': "Save ring builder if dispersion changes

There are cases where a rebalance improves dispersion, but doesn't
improve balance. This is because the balance of a ring builder is
taken to be the balance of its least-balanced device, so if there's a
device that has no partitions, wants some, but can't get them, then
we'll never save the ring builder even if every other device in the
ring got better.

We can detect this situation by looking at the dispersion number; if
it improves, then the new ring is better than the old one, so let's
save it anyway.

Change-Id: Ie239b958fc7e0547ffda2bebf61546bd4ef3d829
"}, {'created': '2017-06-29 18:24:44.000000000', 'message': "Save ring builder if dispersion changes

There are cases where a rebalance improves dispersion, but doesn't
improve balance. This is because the balance of a ring builder is
taken to be the balance of its least-balanced device, so if there's a
device that has no partitions, wants some, but can't get them, then
we'll never save the ring builder even if every other device in the
ring got better.

We can detect this situation by looking at the dispersion number; if
it improves, then the new ring is better than the old one, so let's
save it anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1697543

Change-Id: Ie239b958fc7e0547ffda2bebf61546bd4ef3d829

commit_message:
Save ring builder if dispersion changes

There are cases where a rebalance improves dispersion, but doesn't
improve balance. This is because the balance of a ring builder is
taken to be the balance of its least-balanced device, so if there's a
device that has no partitions, wants some, but can't get them, then
we'll never save the ring builder even if every other device in the
ring got better.

We can detect this situation by looking at the dispersion number; if it
changes, then the rebalance needs to be saved in order to continue to
make progress.

Partial-Bug: #1697543

Change-Id: Ie239b958fc7e0547ffda2bebf61546bd4ef3d829

commit_message:
Modify database-list in OSC

This change modifies database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the database-list command.

The trove command database-list in OSC
before: openstack database list
now: openstack database db list

Change-Id: I3ef4e744050fcfcada6ff3de490149f916304001

subject: New feature for draft function.
messages:
[{'account_id': 19913, 'date': '2017-12-21 05:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-21 05:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19913, 'date': '2017-12-21 05:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add a new table for system role assignments

This commit introduces an additive only database migration for a new
database table. This table will be used only for system-level role
assignments instead of tacking the functionality into the existing
assignment table. The reason for this is that it will be easier to
implement as a separate table and it will be easier to extend
functionality in the future to support more complex system role
assignments.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: Ia0722004b7b851c46e8a72780b3acd31f16f78a6

commit_message:
Install liberasurecode-devel for CentOS 7

Since I747c2b8754effbc6ec82af3bf7543fd9599a6c14 we do not install
the RDO package repository anymore and thus liberasurecode-devel
cannot be installed.

For CentOS 7, remove liberasurecode-devel from bindep.txt and install it
from test-setup.sh instead after enabling the RDO package repositories.

Update python dependencies: CentOS 7 does not have python3. Fix the
SUSE tags.

Change-Id: I72aa6b5455dfb025f54e83334983ac280f04afb2

Right now after creating the rabbitmq pacemaker resource, we have no
guarantee that rabbit will be up. Let's add the same mechanism we use
today with the galera-ready exec resource.

Specifically, we probe that the '{rabbit,' app shows up in the status,
so we can guarantee that rabbit is running before invoking any other
rabbitmqctl commands.

commit_message:
Make sure rabbitmq is fully up before creating any rabbitmq resources

Right now after creating the rabbitmq pacemaker resource, we have no
guarantee that rabbit will be up. Let's add the same mechanism we use
today with the galera-ready exec resource. This gives us the guarantee
that once the resource has been created it is up and we can actually
create rabbitmq users (some 3rd party plugins do that, not stock
TripleO).

Specifically, we probe that the '{rabbit,' app shows up in the status,
so we can guarantee that rabbit is running before invoking any other
rabbitmqctl commands.

Change-Id: Ib37eb2e591f97de54ee6449817ae8d70c6541753
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Looking at the unit test failure, I wonder oslo serialization jsonutils does not handle djangogettext method (i.e., "_"). It might be need to force string evaluation before passing JSON encoder... to avoid serialization error.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-06-20 12:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2017-06-21 08:58:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

I don't think we should be translating API error messages. That would make it extremely difficult to parse them on the other side and figure out what was the error. The API in general is not translated -- we don't translate the parameter names or values or anything like that. I think it's best to keep the API language consistent and simply not translate anything in it.

Having said this, what problem are you trying to solve exactly?"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

'}, {'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2017-12-21 04:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Hi Reedip:

This patch should check while executing "update_policy_rule":
- The rule object is updated with new data:
         rule.update_fields(rule_data, reset_changes=True)
         update()
- The Policy object is updated with this new rule
         policy.obj_load_attr('rules')
- Those commands are executed in this order.

commit_message:
Improve Qos Policy Rule test

The current policy rule tests do not test the actual
rule information involved in the test.
This patch takes care of the same.


Closes-Bug: 1676877
Change-Id: I50ccb9e9237f7e3b2f5c66d1fc3b539905fa0281

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 22:04:21.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the TypeAffinityFilter

Deprecated in Pike:

  I660e0316b11afcad65c0fe7bd167ddcec9239a8b

This filter relies on the flavor.id primary key which will
change as (1) flavors were migrated to the API database and
(2) when a flavor is changed by deleting and re-creating the
flavor.

Also, as noted in blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet,
this is one step forward in getting us to a point where the only
thing that the in-tree filters care about in the HostState.instances
dict is the instance uuid (for the affinity filters). Which means
we can eventually stop RPC casting all instance information from
all nova-compute services to the scheduler for every instance create,
delete, move or periodic sync task - we only would need to send the
list of instance UUIDs. That should help with RPC traffic in a large
and busy deployment.

Change-Id: Icb43fe2ef5252d2838f6f8572c7497840a9797a1
'}, {'created': '2017-12-14 22:10:12.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the TypeAffinityFilter

dict is the instance uuid (for the affinity filters). Which means
we can eventually stop RPC casting all instance information from
all nova-compute services to the scheduler for every instance create,
delete, move or periodic sync task - we only would need to send the

and busy deployment.

Change-Id: Icb43fe2ef5252d2838f6f8572c7497840a9797a1
'}]
commit_message:
Delete the TypeAffinityFilter

Deprecated in Pike:

  I660e0316b11afcad65c0fe7bd167ddcec9239a8b

This filter relies on the flavor.id primary key which will
change as (1) flavors were migrated to the API database and
(2) when a flavor is changed by deleting and re-creating the
flavor.

Also, as noted in blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet,
this is one step forward in getting us to a point where the only
thing that the in-tree filters care about in the HostState.instances
dict is the instance uuid (for the affinity filters). Which means
we can eventually stop RPC casting all instance information from
all nova-compute services to the scheduler for every instance create,
delete, move or periodic sync task - we only would need to send the
list of instance UUIDs. That should help with RPC traffic in a large
and busy deployment.

Change-Id: Icb43fe2ef5252d2838f6f8572c7497840a9797a1

[{'created': '2017-12-20 14:59:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove security group updates

The only thing that the security group updates did was to update the
external_ids of the Address_Set with its current name.

That name wasn't used for anything in networking-ovn either other than
knowing wheter that was a security group created by networking-ovn or
not.

So, instead of having the name saved in the external_ids this patch
changes it to the security group ID which is the canonical identifier of
the resource and won't change.

2. Remove security groups updates

commit_message:
Refactor security groups

This patch does two things:

1. Delete the security group at the AFTER_DELETE notification level

Prior to this patch we were using the BEFORE_DELETE notification level
which can be problematic because if the deletion fails in Neutron we
would have deleted it from OVN already.

2. Remove security groups updates

The only thing that the security group updates did was to update the
external_ids of the Address_Set with its current name.

That name wasn't used for anything in networking-ovn other than knowing
whether the security group was created by networking-ovn or not.

So, instead of having the name saved in the external_ids this patch
changes it to the security group ID which is the canonical identifier of
the resource and won't change.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I5a8b64639d38e11050dae1008b14d48de14ecf94

commit_message:
Skip period test for message

With pymongo3.6, it will break test case test_message_period for
MongoDB. Until we figure out the root cause, this test case will
be skipped.

Closes-Bug: #1739332

Change-Id: I54bc4bd8fd96d422700a9c780bd89382d79fff1e

messages:
[{'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2017-12-15 07:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2017-12-15 08:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-15 11:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Discussions on Editor-specific gitignore entries happens repeatedly, but the general direction is we don't have editor-specific in .gitignore in project repositories. (note that some projects have such but we don't encourage to clean them up and add such to other repos.)
*gitignore_global* in your~/.gitconfig is the more suggested way to have personal gitignore entries."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-18 16:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2017-12-21 04:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
let hacking install its dependencies

hacking pulls in the right versions of flake8, mccabe, pep8 and
pyflakes already, listing them explicitely is unnecessary and
can cause mismatches.

Change-Id: Id44c90ddd4a8a2204fd7ce600097bafbc9469993

commit_message:
Add missing NAME attribute for SessionPersistenceV2

There is a potential error in get resource for session
persistence if we not found it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lbaas/blob/master/neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py#L85

Change-Id: I1b78582e1b62f2f05728a8cc781c683037297022

commit_message:
Test: rescue_interface to base driver class

This commit adds `rescue` interface to `BaseDriver` and implements
it for `fake-hardware` hardware type. It adds configuration
parameters '[DEFAULT]/enabled_rescue_interfaces' and
'[DEFAULT]/default_rescue_interface'. The default value of
configuration parameter '[DEFAULT]/enabled_rescue_interfaces' is
`no-rescue`.

It adds new rescue states and a new 'rescue' field to the Node
object. It adds objects.node.Node._convert_to_version().
The method handles converting the new rescue_interface field
between different versions of the Node.

It also adds a data migration script to fill node.rescue_interface
for hardware type managed nodes to 'no-rescue'.

Change-Id: I8c9bb5c6484fb064c16571a3bce22d674cbd6ba2

This is not needed. We discussed this on irc [1] (and this comment is copied from another patch). Shiv said that the default value for RescueInterface can be None. In which case, the _convert_to_version() should be really simple. With respect to whether we want to do some sort of update/data migration to set the node's rescue interface value to something that is None, we decided (with Julia) no. That we would use the StorageInterface work as a model, and not add any code to do any setting of this value for existing nodes. The operators will have to explicitly set that value to whatever they want. Note too, that it cannot be changed for classic drivers (ie, Rescue is not available with classic drivers.)

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2017-11-30.log.html#t2017-11-30T15:35:14"}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-12-03 07:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-12-06 06:04:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(12 comments)

@Ruby, @Julia: As discussed, I tried making 'None' as a default value for rescue interface for hardware types, but it breaks in config. Had posted this patch (19) with that implementation to see if I missed anything. Further discussed with Dmitry [1]and it seems we cannot do that. We would need tohave 'no-rescue' as the default value for hardware types. In migration script and in  the _convert_to_version() we can set the rescue interface to 'no-rescue' without looking at driver type as driver.rescue would always be 'None' for classic drivers. Will post the patches shortly.
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2017-12-05.log.html#t2017-12-05T10:47:53"}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-12-07 04:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add a data migration to fill node.rescue_interface

This fills node.rescue_interface for hardware type managed nodes to
rescue interface value set in config parameter
'[DEFAULT]/default_rescue_interface'. If it this config parameter is
not set, node.rescue_interface will be populated with 'no-rescue'.

Also adds to existing release note about how rescue_interface is set, to
remind people to check the logic and configs to make sure they get the
expected result.

Change-Id: I0d79400c9e38e22cec30f8059ed0e736fd447994
Partial-bug: #1526449

commit_message:
Use new logic for node name generation

For node to be created with a cluster, this patch adds logic to
generate node name based on cluster config (if provided). If no cluster
is specified, the logic falls back to the old behavior.

Change-Id: I60cff5570cc1cc38f88c44a682b74678639c8d93

commit_message:
Manila network plugin address family support

Set NetworkPluginIpv6Enabled if IPv6 networks
have been enabled.  Currently this parameter and
NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled are mutually exclusive so
set the latter false as well.  Default is IPv4
with NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled.

Depends-On: Ic7e5b5351e429755ba48613ab89d1b7e7d6e2d34
Change-Id: Ia895d7190f0fb8e97c87b3178461d9fc26393b9b

commit_message:
Add configuration-parameter-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the configuration-parameter-show command.

The trove command configuration-parameter-show is now:
    openstack database configuration parameter show

Change-Id: I0a286390135a09b125fab0efa8c83aefec8ca334
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Parse deploy_status_code vs status_code in deployment workbook

It looks like the correct name of the output providing the status
code is deploy_status_code not status_code.

Change-Id: Id9772732cb9affadd10d8325f087380a6d9bdb00
Closes-Bug: #1739305

commit_message:
Patch mkisofs calls

The nova unit tests recently started to fail on systems lacking mkisofs
(like mac osx). Skip these mkisofs calls by patching _make_iso9660.

Change-Id: I350aafa878616f74df506c1bc9ee5f26ea06fe97
Closes-Bug: #1630420
(cherry picked from commit b90df7c9c7042d2a8f104f66220f81ecb2951597)

commit_message:
Remove find_stack_traces.py

This commit removes find_stack_traces because the script looks a bit
rotten. For example, it doesn't care about the current 'Guide to
Devstack Gate Logs' page anymore. And this script isn't used any other
projects. One concern is that there are users who are executing this
script by hand. However, this script doesn't work correctly so far. So,
I think users should stop to use this script.

Change-Id: I8b82b3594c94c22e560300a4128f56d5274e082f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 00:49:14.000000000', 'message': "Update pool member operating status for haproxy

Collection of stats is a period task for which the HAProxy driver also
returns member statuses, including 'status' field which maps to
MemberV2.operating_status. Updating such field in neutron-lbaas DB
ensures the stored operational status is up-to-date. Subsequently, the
operating status of pools, listeners and load balancers can also be
correctly reported to users upon querying in for the load balancer
status tree API.

This fixes cases where a pool member becomes offline in the dataplane
but is not observed in neutron-lbaas. If a member turns back online
again, its operating status will be updated too.

Partial-Bug: #1548774

Change-Id: Ief872b0463002b4e339f8eab71b37a4225d461cc
(cherry picked from commit 80a086695d11aa65251889671a3d729f62779c80)
"}]
commit_message:
Update pool member operating status for haproxy

Collection of stats is a period task for which the HAProxy driver also
returns member statuses, including 'status' field which maps to
MemberV2.operating_status. Updating such field in neutron-lbaas DB
ensures the stored operational status is up-to-date. Subsequently, the
operating status of pools, listeners and load balancers can also be
correctly reported to users upon querying in for the load balancer
status tree API.

This fixes cases where a pool member becomes offline in the dataplane
but is not observed in neutron-lbaas. If a member turns back online
again, its operating status will be updated too.

Partial-Bug: #1548774

Change-Id: Ief872b0463002b4e339f8eab71b37a4225d461cc
(cherry picked from commit 80a086695d11aa65251889671a3d729f62779c80)

commit_message:
Drop django_openstack_auth from projects.txt

In Queens cycle, the code of django_openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repository and django_openstack_auth repository will be
retired.

Note that stable branches (pike and ocata) are still maintained
and we need the global-requirements sync for such branches.

Change-Id: If04778ccc99ea92355378d59e616d8794e36ea14

Further information on the release cycle can be found here:

(9 comments)

Some comments inline.

Can you please let me know how exactly this vendor passthru can work in conjunction with nova ? I mean if the images are cached across nodes, can we make sure in some way that nova picks up a node that has image already cached ? Are you planning some work in that front ? 

Are you planning to put up a spec for this ? I think a lot of these stuffs could be discussed there as this is not a "true" vendor passthru. :)'}, {'account_id': 14228, 'date': '2015-06-10 16:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 14228, 'date': '2015-06-10 17:01:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(9 comments)

@Ramakrishnan: First off, thanks for the review!

This patch is designed to work with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/170681/4 which adds a weigher to Nova which applies differents weight values to an Ironic node depending on the state of caching on the node. For example, if the request calls for a specific image which is currently cached on a specific node N, then N will receive the highest weight from the new weigher, and hopefully that node will receive the highest weight overall. This should cause nova's scheduler to pick node N.

I can create a spec for this if needed. What comprises a 'true' vendor passthru?

I still need to address at least one issue raised by your review of this patch. Please reply to my comments as I'd like to explore your concerns further. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 14228, 'date': '2015-06-10 17:03:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

-1ing for now since there's at least one FIXME in the current patch, and I'd like to disscuss Ramakrishnan's review further.

The latest patch adds a guard against sending cache_image operations to nodes in maintenance, as well as wrapping the heartbeat functionality with a catch-all exception handler to more closely match the hearbeat function found in agent_base_vendor. Also solves pep8 issues related to the recent change in Ironic's pep8 rules."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-10 17:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-05 18:43:59.000000000', 'message': "Added support for image caching for the agent driver

Adds several methods to the agent driver to support image caching on
nodes. Includes validation of the presence of arguments to the cache_image
endpoint, marking the node's driver_info about the presence of a
cached image, asyncronous handling of the caching operation finishing
through the heartbeat method, and several tests surrounding this new
functionality.

Change-Id: I6b577f6a0f3a59ac91e4b6ec980e31390cec3607

Adds several methods to the agent driver to support image caching on
nodes. Includes validation of the presence of arguments to the cache_image
endpoint, marking the node's driver_internal_info dictionary about the
presence of a cached image, asynchronous handling of the caching operation
finishing through the heartbeat method, and several tests surrounding this new
functionality.

There's also some refactoring around creating and deleting Neutron
nodes to reuse code introduced by the agent cleaning driver work.

Change-Id: I6b577f6a0f3a59ac91e4b6ec980e31390cec3607

functionality.

There's also some refactoring around creating and deleting Neutron
nodes to reuse code introduced by the agent cleaning driver work.

Change-Id: I6b577f6a0f3a59ac91e4b6ec980e31390cec3607

commit_message:
Add support for image caching for the agent driver

Adds several methods to the agent driver to support image caching on
nodes. Includes validation of the presence of arguments to the cache_image
endpoint, marking the node's driver_internal_info dictionary about the
presence of a cached image, asynchronous handling of the caching operation
finishing through the heartbeat method, and several tests surrounding this new
functionality.

There's also some refactoring around creating and deleting Neutron
nodes to reuse code introduced by the agent cleaning driver work.

Implements: image-caching (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310594/)
Change-Id: I6b577f6a0f3a59ac91e4b6ec980e31390cec3607

commit_message:
Adding configurability to IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT

Devstack-gate is setting IRONIC_CALLBACK_TIMEOUT statically on devstack, but
with the increasing number of 3rd Party CI deployments on Ironic, the
combination of deploy images and user images that can be used to deploy the
specific types of hardware each vendor use may increase the deploy time in
very specific cases. Thus, this option should be configurable.

Change-Id: I139c381eee64d95af28cd0c5e1a650fefa7caa01

commit_message:
Use the new microversion-parse library to parse the version headers

Used the new microversion-parse library (version 0.1.4) to parse the
headers for Ironic

But still need work on using the new microversion-parse library to
parse headers for Ironic-Inspector

Change-Id: I43c25607cd2580a41bb679fd5dfaac40027e7e91
Partial-Bug: #1584718

subject: Moving redfish_version attribute to Field
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 16635, 'name': 'deray', 'email': 'debayan.ray@gmail.com', 'username': 'deray'}, {'_account_id': 26143, 'name': 'Yusef Shaban', 'email': 'yshaban@godaddy.com', 'username': 'yshaban'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2017-06-12 09:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-12 10:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-sushy-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/gate-sushy-docs-ubuntu-xenial/2db5d10//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- gate-sushy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/gate-sushy-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/564d0bb/ : SUCCESS in 4m 40s
- gate-sushy-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/gate-sushy-python27-ubuntu-xenial/1fe58f3/ : SUCCESS in 4m 32s
- gate-sushy-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/gate-sushy-python35/b509f34/ : SUCCESS in 4m 32s
- sushy-coverage-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/sushy-coverage-ubuntu-xenial/2689bd6/ : SUCCESS in 3m 48s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-redfish-sushy-src-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/39/473339/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-redfish-sushy-src-ubuntu-xenial/5ffc454/ : SUCCESS in 31m 54s'}, {'account_id': 26143, 'date': '2017-06-15 19:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with the code changes if we are to assume that the redfish version is returned in each resource type property for all vendors implementations. If this assumption is false, then the resources themselves would not know their redfish_version. 

That being said, I would argue that if the user was unable to access the redfish_version from their resource they should default to using the root sushy obj's redfish_version. 

If, however, we were to implement some logic within resources that was dependent on redfish_version, I would argue that we would not know our version 100% of the time and that passing in the redfish_version from root is still the best option. 

I have tested 3 vendor implementations of redfish and each does not return the redfish version in any resource's @odata.type.  With these vendors the redifsh_version would be empty."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-06-28 12:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't have access to redfish hardware so I cannot test, although Yusef raises a very valid point and evidence that object level data types are not always versioned.  I believe the correct action in this case is a hybrid approach.  Upon init, like previous, extract the version and store it.  IF the class loads with version data, then use that for the version, otherwise fallback to version collected from the initial call to the root of the api."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-06-28 13:56:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While this could make sense, I'm not sure  we have the time to gracefully handle it, and as such I'm tempted to block this until the next release cycle, especially since it conflicts with the other patches for Sushy. Thoughts/opinions would be appreciated."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-28 17:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2017-06-30 07:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@Yusef, good insight and thinking of the issues which may crop up related to versions in redfish resources. Please find my commends below:

> I agree with the code changes if we are to assume that the redfish version is returned in each resource type property for all vendors implementations. If this assumption is false, then the resources themselves would not know their redfish_version.

From the portion of the specification [0] I am referring to related to type-property, @odata.type, I find that the "Namespace" is defined as:

    'The full namespace name of the Redfish Schema in which the type is defined. For Redfish resources this will be the versioned namespace name.'

where the property value is of the form '#Namespace.TypeName'. From this I presume that the value has to a versionised string and to be properly compliant to Redfish the vendor needs to provide that version (it's not a optional part). Now having said so I do agree that some vendors may omit that version in their initial implementation, if not in their later versions, and probably as a library provider we will have to accommodate all these hardwares.

> That being said, I would argue that if the user was unable to access the redfish_version from their resource they should default to using the root sushy obj's redfish_version. If, however, we were to implement some logic within resources that was dependent on redfish_version, I would argue that we would not know our version 100% of the time and that passing in the redfish_version from root is still the best option.

Very rightly said. I feel redfish_version from the root resource is a good choice as a fallback option. Julia already endorses the idea. Let's hear other opinions.

> I have tested 3 vendor implementations of redfish and each does not return the redfish version in any resource's @odata.type.  With these vendors the redifsh_version would be empty.

I do understand these kind of situations would be aplenty rather than exceptions at this point of time. Btw, thanks for sharing this evidential info. It will definitely help in shaping up this patch.

[0] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.1.html#type-property


@Julia, thanks for looking into this. My comments below and one comment as inlined:

> I don't have access to redfish hardware so I cannot test, although Yusef raises a very valid point and evidence that object level data types are not always versioned.  I believe the correct action in this case is a hybrid approach.  Upon init, like previous, extract the version and store it.  IF the class loads with version data, then use that for the version, otherwise fallback to version collected from the initial call to the root of the api.

Fair enough solution. I also second the thought. ++

> In discussion with Dmitry, we are worried this is a breaking change requiring a major version bump.  While this could make sense, I'm not sure  we have the time to gracefully handle it, and as such I'm tempted to block this until the next release cycle, especially since it conflicts with the other patches for Sushy. Thoughts/opinions would be appreciated.

I am absolutely fine in having this blocked until next release cycle mostly due to the major version bumping in case of backward-incompatible API change. But if we take the approach of fallback option to root resource redfish version in case of version absence in resource data type, then probably we can jolly well get going w/o any breaking change, inherently with the same API, in effect w/o major version bumping. Btw, I do agree that time is obviously a concern here but I am still open for any thoughts / opinions on this.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2017-06-30 07:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}]

commit_message:
Moving redfish_version attribute to Field

Till now the property 'redfish_version' was getting picked up
from root resource response and was getting passed down to all
resources while creation from Sushy class. This patch changes
the way this attribute picks its value from for any resource.

All resources in their response shall include a type property
named "@odata.type". This will contain the version-ised
namespace name of the Redfish Schema in which the type is
defined. The Field-ified 'redfish_version' property will now
get its value from this version string of this namespace value.

Change-Id: I0cde44b4f9c355a18ca5f79c4fb4b9d352a04be0

So, we talked about this some in IRC today, and decided it should be architected a bit differently. We should have a GET endpoint that returns the steps currently known, with a 200, and with a "last updated" timestamp that may be null. We should also have a POST (or maybe a PUT?) endpoint to update these (including booting the agent etc). 

In any case, I don't think we should land this in Mitaka, and we won't have it in the Mitaka client anyway, so applying a -2 here. Feel free to continue iterating and soliciting reviews, and we can land this in Newton. Please do ping me if I forget to remove the -2 when Newton opens.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2016-03-23 13:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add 'GET /nodes/<node>/cleaning/steps' API request

Add 'GET /nodes/<node_ident>/cleaning/steps' API request that
returns a list of the cleaning steps that are available for a
particular node.

Partial-Bug: #1526290
Co-Authored-By: Debayan Ray <debayan.ray@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If2231f271e93ee4412e6a8d1d5bb3f8d7c36142d

commit_message:
Add create external event functionality

This patch allows to create an external ironic event with
ironicclient.

Change-Id: Ie14635d2ba6f52daab9f48596d6397621fb38815
Related-Bug: #1304673

(5 comments)

Hi Vladyslav,

I would prefer move the test files first, and then do the refactor. I'm OK to do some trivial refactor at the same time. But as you have pointed out, if the refactor does affect tests, I think I'd prefer to keep it in the old way first.

So, I'd like to push a new version and do the least refactor to make the code look nice.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-01 09:02:11.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually started a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copy them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily do functional tests.

Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670

'}, {'created': '2016-09-08 11:48:59.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

And also, in ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py, routing
test is more like a functional test because it is
based on a real runing pecan server. But check_version
test is just a unit test. So we move routing test
to functional dir. We should add at least a functional test
here to avoid error when running "tox -e functional".

This patch does the least refactor to base.py. And will do
more when the moving job has finished.

Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
