commit_message:
Prepare for functional tests

Functional test is not enabled in Ironic. But many unit
tests are over tested because they are not faking anything,
but actually start a real pecan server to do the tests.

Bug #1607679 aims to split them. This patch could be the
first step of it.

DbTestCase and BaseApiTest are base classes for functional
tests. They should be put in functional dir. This patch
copies them to functional dir instead of moving so that we
can keep the current unit tests code untouched. And when
we finish to grab all the functional tests out, we can
simply remove the ones in unit dir.

This patch also enables functional tests in tox.ini. And
the follow-up patches can easily add more functional tests.

And also, in ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py, routing
test is more like a functional test because it is
based on a real runing pecan server. But check_version
test is just a unit test. So we move routing test
to functional dir. We should add at least a functional test
here to avoid error when running "tox -e functional".

This patch does the least refactor to base.py. And will do
more when the moving job has finished.

Co-Authored-By: jiangwei <wei.jiang@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ib58635aa7f8518632053338f7d83e1bdb593bfc4
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670

commit_message:
Add validation for portgroup mode

This patch adds a validation for portgroup mode which can be any
one of:

* balance-rr
* 802.3ad
* active-backup
* balance-xor
* broadcast
* balance-alb
* balance-tlb

Please refer https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt
for more details.

Change-Id: I0fbacf3776ac086c95198ae08a2128dc88f5308c
Closes-Bug: #1701156

commit_message:
Fix stable states validation in FSM

States ENROLL and ERROR should not be set as target states, they are
removed from states.STABLE_STATES. This change fixes behavior of
_validate_target_state() FSM method. Description of STABLE_STATES
updated.

Change-Id: I734de0be535eeb4a612265ce5893ec511f9f4327

John, I am sorry I am replying so late. In both cases dictionary is constructed basing on object retrieved from db. Result, rpc_port, is of type objects.Port, that inherits from base.IronicObject. Therefore, as_dict method is method of parent class (IronicObject), and fields are based on "fields" dictionary defined per each specific object - in this case Port. As Port's fields dictionary contains node_id, it should always be contained in both cases.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2016-11-30 19:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> John, I am sorry I am replying so late. In both cases dictionary is
 > constructed basing on object retrieved from db. Result, rpc_port,
 > is of type objects.Port, that inherits from base.IronicObject.
 > Therefore, as_dict method is method of parent class (IronicObject),
 > and fields are based on "fields" dictionary defined per each
 > specific object - in this case Port. As Port's fields dictionary
 > contains node_id, it should always be contained in both cases.

Thanks. Makes sense. I'll look at this patch more when I get some free  time.'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2016-12-08 21:25:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Given this could break existing users, does this need to be hidden behind a microversion? I know it's just a bug fix but it does change the behavior of this API endpoint significantly."}, {'account_id': 13295, 'date': '2016-12-08 21:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23883, 'date': '2016-12-09 11:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Jay, I'll wait for other opinions on the microversion.
In terms of API usage it will affect patch, where somebody explicitly sets node_uuid to non-uuid value... for me it's self explanatory, that uuid should be used, and the fact that sb could use other values seems like a pentesting thing more than actual usage :)"}, {'account_id': 23883, 'date': '2016-12-09 11:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2016-12-09 12:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hello Joanna, thanks for the updates. I really struggle with this patch, as the code in these setters in our API is really convoluted. Some comments inline. Basically, this patch stops using the setters that we have in wsme.property definitions and uses a _set_<smth>_identifiers functions, making those setters basically pointless. Also, it does not seem to prevent the issue you're talking about in the commit message. Updated API with this patch and I'm still able to do:

 ironic port-update f5b8c1d4-be4f-438f-8d20-25e408b3a40f add node_uuid=13

just fine. As I said, I think the problem is, you don't actually use the setters that do UUID validation anymore."}, {'account_id': 23883, 'date': '2017-02-03 23:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Allowed types are noew uuid and Unset.

commit_message:
Add UUID validation to port and portgroup PATCH methods.

Fix node_id being passed to node_uuid setters for port and portgroup
in PATCH methods. Instead, node is retrieved and its UUID is passed.
Add validation of value passed to these setters.
Allowed types are now UUID and Unset.

Fix portgroup_id being passed to portgroup_uuid setters for port
in PATCH method. Instead, portgroup is retrieved and its UUID is passed.
Add validation of value passed to portgroup_uuid setter.
Allowed types are now UUID, Unset and None.

Change-Id: Ic988a5e903279b38a82f195c58055036dafba8ff
Closes-Bug: #1301046
Signed-off-by: Joanna Taryma <joanna.taryma@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add glean package in requirements.txt

Glean is a simple program to build a system from configuration
provided in a configuration drive.
This patch adds Glean in requirements.txt so that later the
program can be used to write static config from configuration drive.

Change-Id: I824eff463194c20e8da23cd762488cd38741bea3

commit_message:
Adds functionality test for erase_devices

This commit adds the support to test the clean
step erase_devices functionally as a manual
clean step.

Change-Id: I712548501c24018adcd0f86b6399d60ba538abd9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-17 08:41:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /etc/machine-id

This file will cause problems with running distros that are based on
systemd on distros that do not have systemd (ie runnign 16.04 on 14.04).
This file need not exist in the container anyway as it is empty

Change-Id: I4487e160077c64ed4b5d9561483f25c3a37bd455
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/machine-id

This file will cause problems with running distros that are based on
systemd on distros that do not have systemd (ie runnign 16.04 on 14.04).
This file need not exist in the container anyway as it is empty

Change-Id: I4487e160077c64ed4b5d9561483f25c3a37bd455

commit_message:
Fix Makefile

This patch sets fixes the make clean target as it currently attempts
to delete the generated */charts up the parents, where the directory
is guaranteed to be non-empty.

Change-Id: Id1327998cc1cdc73bdf0113d5ec68330d9fc70f0

commit_message:
Use generic netcat syntax in base scenario

Current syntax only works with busybox netcat, directly call the script
after making it executable so it works with all versions of netcat (and
all base test images)

Change-Id: I398ab7147faf9487f157930c5bf4da0448f96527

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Remove the now unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Ic89940a03e308fab051b8051ff281724e6488306

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

tox_install.sh was also building ovs for functional test. Move this into
tools/setup-ovs.sh and call it from functional tox environment.

Change-Id: I5857c8ae3e945328c0f24bda37629ce7e0faefa7

commit_message:
Fix upgrades from older charm versions

Ensure that netaddr and netifaces are installed on upgrade from
older py2 based charms to the newer py3 based execution.

Change-Id: I1c7b2eb545e5ef5b40ab2db5a1a968ceb7d916e1
Closes-Bug: 1738979

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-02 19:02:09.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Enhance neutron plugin to use the neutron ironic port mapping

This is a prototype implementation on the ironic side for the proposed
neutron-ironic port mapping function. It's based on the ironic neutron
plugin that's currently in review, but trying to solve the following
issue:

-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for the provisioning and
   cleaning networks
-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for a particular neutron
   tenant network

With the help of neutron ironic port mapping function, neutron
vif_id is no longer needed to be cached in the ironic port object.

To use as much as the existing code, the vif_id for the provisioning
network or the cleaning network is cached in the node object.

Related-Bug: 1552364

Change-Id: I7accc2afcd3db708a65054530ab3ea42272549f9
"}, {'created': '2016-03-08 17:23:06.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Enhance neutron plugin to use the neutron ironic port mapping

-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for the provisioning and

With the help of neutron ironic port mapping function, neutron

To use as much as the existing code, the vif_id for the provisioning

commit_message:
[WIP] Enhance neutron plugin to use the neutron ironic port mapping

This is a prototype implementation on the ironic side for the proposed
neutron-ironic port mapping function. It's based on the ironic neutron
plugin that's currently in review, but trying to solve the following
issue:

-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for the provisioning and
   cleaning networks
-- which ironic port/portgroup should be used for a particular neutron
   tenant network

With the help of neutron ironic port mapping function, neutron
vif_id is no longer needed to be cached in the ironic port object.

To use as much as the existing code, the vif_id for the provisioning
network or the cleaning network is cached in the node object.

Related-Bug: 1552364

Change-Id: I7accc2afcd3db708a65054530ab3ea42272549f9

A few notes:
1. Generally, the calls for bool(var) should be equally good as isinstance(var, wtypes.UnsetType). Both are used in this code (see comments), IMO, bool(var) would contribute to much cleaner code.

2. It never updates the QoS policy of the vip-port.
e.g.
openstack port create my_port --qos-policy qos1
openstack loadbalancer create --vip-port-id my_port --vip-qos-policy-id qos2 --name lb

openstack port show --> actual result: qos_policy = qos1
Is that what we want?'}, {'account_id': 25239, 'date': '2017-12-12 01:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 58:

'}, {'created': '2017-04-26 10:47:08.000000000', 'message': "Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

This patch modify the LoadbalancerPost/Put request body and response
body. And extend the 'vip' table with an new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron. Add ApplyQos task in
loadbalancer_post_task_flows and loadbalancer_update_task_flows.
Then add some Uts and api tests.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I43aba9d2ae816b1498d16da077936d6bdb62e30a
"}, {'created': '2017-05-02 06:51:58.000000000', 'message': "Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

body. It also extends the 'vip' table with the new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron.

commit_message:
Extend api to accept qos_policy_id

This patch extend Octavia v2 API to access qos_policy_id from neutron.
Users can pass it as 'vip_qos_policy_id' to Octavia request body to
create/update Loadbalancers, and the vrrp ports will have the qos
abilities.

This patch modifies the Loadbalancer Post/Put request body and response
body. It also extends the 'vip' table with the new column named
'qos_policy_id' to store the qos_id from neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I43aba9d2ae816b1498d16da077936d6bdb62e30a

commit_message:
Add new "amttool" driver based on amttool.pl script

The "amtterm" project provides a simple Perl script for interacting
with AMT v7 and v8 hardware. This utility is available from the
"amtterm" package on Ubuntu 14.04 (and other distros), and was imported
previously in commit I6cfb4c804af00cfeb364017566e21b9c34cb6316

This commit implements simple Power and Management interfaces, and
bindings for PXE and Agent deploy methods.

Change-Id: I51fa7147a642c01953169edd61058d09e15a6e5f

commit_message:
Make a few changes to amttool.pl

A few changes to the imported perl script were necessary to facilitate
ease of use:
- remove the required interactive prompt
- add a minimal "powerinfo" command

Change-Id: I114ad1d1119aa0cb1798f7da5d29f08022865f70

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 15:41:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Increase guest agent cmd process timeout

A previous commit attempted to set the guest agent command
process timeout value high but had a copy-paste error in
the line that actually sets the environment variable value
into the guest conf file.

This fixes the copy-paste issue.

Change-Id: Ib8aa566fb34eb52e2541d0ccb595234373e01bc2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Increase guest agent cmd process timeout

A previous commit attempted to set the guest agent command
process timeout value high but had a copy-paste error in
the line that actually sets the environment variable value
into the guest conf file.

This fixes the copy-paste issue.

Change-Id: Ib8aa566fb34eb52e2541d0ccb595234373e01bc2

commit_message:
Prometheus: Update values to be yaml rather than freeform text

This PS udpates the Prometheus values to use yaml rather than text.

It also consolates all configuration into a single `etc` configmap,
inline with other OSH charts.

commit_message:
cfg.CONF must not be used directly

cfg.CONF must not be used directly, Config().oslo_conf_obj must be used
instead.

Closes-bug: #1737119

Change-Id: I58ec9e25c7f04a8352535d8861e09c7e4c4c0a9d

Man this is ugly isnt it? I dont really see another way around this. Please give ideas and feedback before we merge this'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2017-11-05 02:03:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I don't have any good suggestions, aside from being sure that the gate will catch if things change from underneath us."}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-05 05:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

so nothing will break when requirements change from underneath us. new requirements and new versions of existing requirements that exist as whl upstream will simply be downloaded and then removed (like we are doing now). we will just have toupdate the ignored_wheels files every so often, but it wont *break* anything unless a project in the ignored list *stops* publishing wheels.

We can write a bot to update these lists when needed probably. But ill have to talk to infra about that'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2017-11-22 18:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-20 21:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I892f9c0731cd5df6b9b227e7dffbfa68ed309a34'}]

commit_message:
Ignore wheels that exist natively whl upstream

This prevents ~200MB of needless pypi downloading and speeds up the
build process, esspecially in environments without a PyPI mirror.

Change-Id: Icb36ad752923730f5daca22ef08455551e1161a8

 > > most of the projects are used to control the permissions of the
 > > policy. If we remove these just because we have written
 > permission
 > > inside our code, I do not think this is a good thing.
 > 
 > So you want to keep those things for what?

In my opinion, this permission control should not be static. And when we want to change, such a change allows us to pass only the code, not the configuration file. Looks like the configuration file is more convenient (I think so, there are mistakes please correct.)'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-12-06 02:30:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > > I want to know if this is a kind of progress or a step
 > backward,
 > > > most of the projects are used to control the permissions of the
 > > > policy. If we remove these just because we have written
 > > permission
 > > > inside our code, I do not think this is a good thing.

 > In my opinion, this permission control should not be static. And
 > when we want to change, such a change allows us to pass only the
 > code, not the configuration file. Looks like the configuration file
 > is more convenient (I think so, there are mistakes please correct.)

We are using the same way with oslo.config as you know, that mean we just define the default rules in codebase and will update it by configuration file if need, then those permission control is not static.

If you want to update some of them, you can pass the some new rules via configuration file (just some of them, not all, other rules have default values).

Summary, we just delete the file that contain all of rule definitions (/etc/trove/policy.json) and if users want to update some things, it's very easy with configuration file (these rules will override default rules)."}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22694, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:48:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Remove policy.json file

We already had default rule in code, so we should not
still define all of them again in policy file.
Besides, we should you yaml format for now instead json.

Another thing, we don't need to config policy file in
Devstack enviroment.

Change-Id: I783ba51695271d358764557899fe91e84620556d

commit_message:
ansible: handle mount of /sys the same way IPA does it

* Mount with -t sysfs instead of a bind mount
* Retry umounting of each directory several times.

I'm seeing occasional failures unmounting /sys, as it's still busy.
This patch should fix it.

Change-Id: I4bc6dfd6939699f7a4ed7cc59e2e503b46bbaeaf

commit_message:
Add cluster-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the cluster-delete command.

The trove command cluster-delete is now:
    openstack database cluster delete

Change-Id: Ibf8f0670231799508a902cffd332c844584ed407
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add the list of hw_version supported by vmware driver.

This patch add the list of hw_version supported by vmware driver.
The corresponding relationships are as following:
vmx-13: ESXi6.5
vmx-11: ESXi6.0
vmx-10: ESXi5.5
vmx-09: ESXi5.1
vmx-08: ESXi5.0
vmx-07: ESXi/ESX4.x
vmx-04: ESX3.x
vmx-03: ESX2.x

Change-Id: I1796b461855081f758b0585c9a0165c5138669d5

commit_message:
Use parameter to control the docker registry env file creation

By setting force: no the created script files are rendered only
once. The role should allow multiple runs and update the scripts
according to the latest options passed by the user. This change
controls the scripts creation by vars in order to be able to
create or not the script files.

Change-Id: I1594ddfda11ac638ba65625964c0a492ad9e6e18

subject: Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2016-02-17 20:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-02-17 20:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2016-03-15 20:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Mauro, thank you for the patch. baremetal flavor is used not only by tempest, I think it should be created without tempest also.'}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2016-03-16 20:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi, thanks for your review.

Let me clarify here: as the bug report says, the way we're doing right now the DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE **can't** be honored. We're lucky that upstream tests don't really depend on the flavor cause it uses VM, we're, at IBM, working on CI using real baremetal nodes, and we do depend on flavor, which specifies our arch (ppc64) as target.

Please clarify: where else is the baremetal flavor used besides tempest's tests? Which damage can this patch (along w/ the other two deps) do in those places? With such explanation I can think in better solution.
Thanks"}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2016-03-17 07:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As you know Ironic is poorly covered by tests. At the moment there is only one "BaremetalBasicOps" tempest test scenario. Mostly when developers write a code, they do not launch tempest since it is not cover many use-cases.

Community did a lot of work to move devstack/tempest related code to Projects repository. At the moment Ironic uses both devstack and tempest plugins. This split gives an opportunity to Ironic's team manage ironic related options without involving other teams. It includes installation and tests. I think that we should follow this way and keep Project(Ironic) related stuff at the project repository.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-12-11 18:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Hi! We are starting migrating our tempest plugin to a separate repository - https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin/ We expect the migration to be finished by Thursday, please re-propose your changes there. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-12-20 20:32:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Vasyl's long ago statement. That being said, with refactoring coming with resource classes, it also seems conflicting to make these changes. Coupled with no reply in over a year, I believe it is time for us to abandon this change."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-12-20 20:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking abandoned as this change was last revised over a year ago. If we wish to move forward on this change, we can always restore it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-17 20:10:11.000000000', 'message': "Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempestcause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in
tempest, and I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1, in devstack, to
fix that by moving the baremetal flavor creation back into lib/tempest
(which makes sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic)
and *using* a new option in tempest baremetal.instance_type that will be
used exclusively for ironic tests (similar idea at tempest's tree for
orchestration.instance_type).

Change-Id: I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941
Depends-on: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Depends-on: I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c
Partial-bug: #1546706
"}]
commit_message:
Devstack: Move baremeteal flavor creation back into devstack

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempestcause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in
tempest, and I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1, in devstack, to
fix that by moving the baremetal flavor creation back into lib/tempest
(which makes sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic)
and *using* a new option in tempest baremetal.instance_type that will be
used exclusively for ironic tests (similar idea at tempest's tree for
orchestration.instance_type).

Change-Id: I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941
Depends-on: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Depends-on: I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c
Partial-bug: #1546706

commit_message:
Termination Panel and Token handler

The panel is under settings, and gives options for both
deleteing an account and simply clearing resources.

The token handler for clearing an account simply confirms it,
whereas for deleting an account it also confirms that they do want
to remove their project instead of just clearing all of their
resources.

Change-Id: Ib85bd498c19b37e007383b143ac5f263ec7f0f62

commit_message:
Correct typo in manila/share.pp resource chaining

A typo error resulted in an attempted resource chaining of
Ceph::Key[client.manila] to Exec[exec-setfacl-manila-manila]. The
actual exec resource is Exec[exec-setfacl-manila]

Change-Id: I78eec6022211b0e82c06599dea300961a2309f0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 12:14:18.000000000', 'message': 'Small refactor of translation scripts

The modulename parameter for setup_projects are not needed anymore,
their usage has been removed with retirement of mitaka. Remove these
parameter.

Call setup_project only once per project and not for both python and
django setup. Also, move the zanata pull out to not have to create a
lock.

Change-Id: Iaf58a6882527eee3ce6528b516fe0f24f51cd976
'}]
commit_message:
Small refactor of translation scripts

The modulename parameter for setup_projects are not needed anymore,
their usage has been removed with retirement of mitaka. Remove these
parameter.

Call setup_project only once per project and not for both python and
django setup. Also, move the zanata pull out to not have to create a
lock.

Change-Id: Iaf58a6882527eee3ce6528b516fe0f24f51cd976

commit_message:
Add instance-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the instance-delete command.

The trove command delete is now:
    openstack database instance delete

Change-Id: Id052d14190e9fbdfe10db4e043fa78d6aef83ba9
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add possibility to inspect systems with multiple CPUs

This feature gives possibility to inspect each CPU separately
and to get info about each of them.

In inspected cpu info now contains list of CPU objects.

Change-Id: Id93b8ffcd1cf058e881ca4e888d1fd56466c156a

subject: Added Parameter horizon_upload_mode
messages:
[{'account_id': 27517, 'date': '2017-12-19 14:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-19 14:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24184, 'date': '2017-12-19 14:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Adds a new Puppet parameter "horizon_upload_mode" which goes into
the local_settings.py configuration file and allows to change
the parameter "HORIZON_IMAGES_UPLOAD_MODE"
to one of "legacy", "off" or "direct" (default is "legacy").

Change-Id: I2e36227d318dd74267ad23f14595481b379cbbd6
Closes-Bug: 1738814
'}]
commit_message:
Added Parameter horizon_upload_mode

Adds a new Puppet parameter "horizon_upload_mode" which goes into
the local_settings.py configuration file and allows to change
the parameter "HORIZON_IMAGES_UPLOAD_MODE"
to one of "legacy", "off" or "direct" (default is "legacy").

Change-Id: I2e36227d318dd74267ad23f14595481b379cbbd6
Closes-Bug: 1738814

[{'created': '2015-10-06 21:33:00.000000000', 'message': "Not depending on bash

Allowing to use the agent without bash shell,
just requiring POSIX compatible shell.

The used scripts are able to work without modification with most shell,
but since the '[[' ']]' just on optional part of POSIX shell they are changed to
'[' usage.

This change also adds extra quotes to several variables.

Change-Id: Ia0cd39cc346db789f4307787038096ad842dff51
"}]
commit_message:
Not depending on bash

Allowing to use the agent without bash shell,
just requiring POSIX compatible shell.

The used scripts are able to work without modification with most shell,
but since the '[[' ']]' just on optional part of POSIX shell they are changed to
'[' usage.

This change also adds extra quotes to several variables.

Change-Id: Ia0cd39cc346db789f4307787038096ad842dff51

commit_message:
clean up non-install parts of contributor docs

- remove specific comments about preferring notifications v. polling
just say, polling can add load
- remove kafka publisher reference
- remove database publisher reference
- move key links (wiki, launchpad, ml, etc...) to index
- put all meter details in one area
- clean up testing

Change-Id: I1993a9945334ffe631f2ddb3dcd0316d0e71f258
(cherry picked from commit 48751822dd1fad3c652cd1a5cc9a60c6a2a15fb8)

commit_message:
Use native v3 tox jobs

Instead of a legacy tox job, use the already defined functional jobs
that do the same. Note that those jobs are named "functional", so update
tox.ini as well.

Remove unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Icdb1b94b0e69ffb55007e166705871010e8943c5
(cherry picked from commit 396ce758e9f1c6ec2e02aa284a722fd624af6b2e)

commit_message:
tests: test-cinder-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I6e6a232a213f0951f3d5fff8b4efac5898ce6d76
(cherry picked from commit 6b739f21e3fade24be51898e672dee9098402574)

I don't think https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1268676 is a blocker for this one, as it's about nova accepting domain scoped tokens. The last I heard, the nova team is never planning to add that support and will instead use hierarchical projects for that use case. That bug also won't affect Horizon, as we never send a domain scoped token to nova.


https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+bug/1522402 looks like it could cause some Cinder and Heat features to break, though. Sounds like a valid blocker for this change."}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2016-10-24 02:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2016-10-24 02:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Updating default keystone API verson to 3

Updating to use the Keystone API v3 by default. This will result
in the default for Horizon being v3 as well.

Implements blueprint: default-keystone-api-3

Change-Id: I2113fff3307da4045abbdd45ae93650ee918fdd9

commit_message:
Fix region sticky issue

This could be a regression issue since it works before. But now,
after user login, and switch the region, logout and re-login, the
region last time used can't be sticky. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ib922c6b32307d2b07582c9c0b25102e7cb53bbf8
Close-Bug: #1704239

commit_message:
Make the allowed_address_pairs driver better

The allowed address pairs network driver did not handle having objects
already deleted properly and would prematurely fail.
This patch improves the edge case handling of the driver.

Change-Id: Ice15aa2d6309648da43d6a40ce0286d5dce17500
Story: 2001258
Task: 5791

commit_message:
Configure backends from API host

The tasks to configure cinder backends require that the API be
available. Since the API service should be installed after the volume
service, run these tasks against an API host instead of a volume host.

Change-Id: I6f39b4da6d4d8a3768f157c73970fe0177885ff3

commit_message:
Disable unstable tempest test_run_ssh_proxied_action test

This disables test_run_ssh_proxied_action. Currently it causes the tests to
fail frequently which makes them less useful and blocks patches incorrectly.

Related-Bug: #1736685

are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

commit_message:
Fix docs builds

With the new way of generating docs in the gate[1] our autodoc builds
are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: I77a09349304451041491893466ca98ba6ebdf96b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23458, 'name': 'Dong Jun', 'email': 'dongjun.01@bytedance.com', 'username': 'Dongj'}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]

Great work, I left some comments, questions and suggestions inline as well.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-11-23 07:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-11-27 06:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-11-27 10:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-11-27 10:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

> (1 comment)

Thanks for testing out. Let me take a look.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > > (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks for testing out. Let me take a look.

I would argue that it doesn't make much sense to have same dns name for 2 ports. Ideally it should be unique.
Since we use dictionary to store records, it would get overriden when a port is created or updated with dns name already in use.

Lets say, p1 is created with dns 'p1'
So records = {'p1': '10.0.0.4'}

When p2 is created with dns 'p1'
records = {'p1': '10.0.0.5'}

When p2 is deleted, 'p1' from the records dict will be deleted which is expected.

I would personally feel we don't need to overcomplicate and try to support these usecases.

Thoughts ?"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (3 comments)
 > >
 > > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Thanks for testing out. Let me take a look.
 > 
 > I would argue that it doesn't make much sense to have same dns name
 > for 2 ports. Ideally it should be unique.
 > Since we use dictionary to store records, it would get overriden
 > when a port is created or updated with dns name already in use.
 > 
 > Lets say, p1 is created with dns 'p1'
 > So records = {'p1': '10.0.0.4'}
 > 
 > When p2 is created with dns 'p1'
 > records = {'p1': '10.0.0.5'}
 > 
 > When p2 is deleted, 'p1' from the records dict will be deleted
 > which is expected.
 > 
 > I would personally feel we don't need to overcomplicate and try to
 > support these usecases.
 > 
 > Thoughts ?

There's two points about the races here.

1st point: The race does not happen only when two ports are created with the same DNS name, it could happens between the deletion of one port and the creation of another one. Which is the same problem we have for Address Sets at the moment: https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1611852

So even if we enforce dns_name to be unique via the Neutron API, the race could still happen between the time it's deleted from OVNDB and the time of creation in NeutronDB.

2nd point: From a UX standpoint, networking-ovn should adhere to what is allowed in the Neutron API.

Otherwise, the API is not good if each backend technology behaves differently from each other.

If someone using Neutron/OVS runs:

$ openstack port create port1 --dns-name mydns --device vm1
$ openstack port create port2 --dns-name mydns --device vm2

And that's a use case, and that works, he can expect that Neutron/OVN will also work for that (it's the exactly same input).

...

We could make an argument that the use case for having the same dns_name in the API for different ports shouldn't be allowed (getting the API to have a minimum common standard) but, even then we will still hist the 1st problem due to the OVNDB design."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks Numan, this is a great feature to have.
I'd personally go ahead with this patch but Lucas' concerns are totally valid even though they could be corner cases. We would need to agree on how to fix it later and clarify it (in code and maybe open a bug?). What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I believe we should proceed and document the known limitations that Lucas pointed out. And then work it out from the core ovn side to enhance the nbdb design so we can avoid this kind of issues.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-19 10:57:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I believe we should proceed and document the known limitations that
 > Lucas pointed out. And then work it out from the core ovn side to
 > enhance the nbdb design so we can avoid this kind of issues.

Yeah, my -1 is only so that we add some FIXME/TODO in the code at least. I'm fine with the code and approach but we need to make sure that the fix in NBDB or ovn-northd won't break anything later on :)
I'm keen on +2ing as soon as we have some comments in the code so that it doesn't slip through the cracks :)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-12-19 11:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I believe we should proceed and document the known limitations that
 > Lucas pointed out. And then work it out from the core ovn side to
 > enhance the nbdb design so we can avoid this kind of issues.

I'm fine with getting this in but I think we need to:

1. As miguel said, document the problem. But also open a bug ticket explaining the problem.

2. Also in the bug ticket it would be good if we put some thoughts at how we should fix it later on, cause we will need to do in a backward compatible way which can be tricky.

...

@Numan, I wonder if we can later fix this without changing the schema ? Here's an idea:

Right now the "records" column is a map that looks like: records = {<dns domain>: <ips>, <dns domain>: <ips>}.

Would be possible to use it differently in the OVN-NBDB, like: records = {<port id>: [<dns domain>, <ip>, <ip>], ...} ? The first element of the list would be the domain and all the subsequent values would be the ip addresses.

That way we just need to change the ovn-northd service to convert it back to records = {<domain>: <ips>} when populating the OVN-SBDB and wouldn't require any schema change.

It's just an idea, what do you think ?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-19 18:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > I believe we should proceed and document the known limitations
 > that
 > > Lucas pointed out. And then work it out from the core ovn side to
 > > enhance the nbdb design so we can avoid this kind of issues.
 > 
 > I'm fine with getting this in but I think we need to:
 > 
 > 1. As miguel said, document the problem. But also open a bug ticket
 > explaining the problem.
 > 
 > 2. Also in the bug ticket it would be good if we put some thoughts
 > at how we should fix it later on, cause we will need to do in a
 > backward compatible way which can be tricky.
 > 
 > ...
 > 
 > @Numan, I wonder if we can later fix this without changing the
 > schema ? Here's an idea:
 > 
 > Right now the "records" column is a map that looks like: records =
 > {<dns domain>: <ips>, <dns domain>: <ips>}.
 > 
 > Would be possible to use it differently in the OVN-NBDB, like:
 > records = {<port id>: [<dns domain>, <ip>, <ip>], ...} ? The first
 > element of the list would be the domain and all the subsequent
 > values would be the ip addresses.
 > 
 > That way we just need to change the ovn-northd service to convert
 > it back to records = {<domain>: <ips>} when populating the OVN-SBDB
 > and wouldn't require any schema change.
 > 
 > It's just an idea, what do you think ?

@Lucas - I need to experiment a bit on this one :). Not sure if this is possible.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-19 19:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-20 03:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-20 08:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

may be DLRN/tripleo is faling because of releasenotes?'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

trying out a build without the release notes, to see if that's what troubles DLNR"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I fixed ovn_api.py because it made pep8 to fail with a tricky error. I found it by running flake8 manually'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-20 12:20:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

> I fixed ovn_api.py because it made pep8 to fail with a tricky
 > error. I found it by running flake8 manually

I missed this comment and uploaded again'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-20 12:57:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

I'm fine with this patch and the TODOs included. Let's see what others say. As discussed earlier, in the future we'll want to have the dns info per port instead of per network to avoid those races but that can be done at a later stage. Thanks Numan!"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2017-12-20 13:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Leaving the last call & workflow to anybody outside red hat :)'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-20 15:22:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Thanks. Waiting for Lucas and for Dong's comments and reviews.

@Dong - Are you fine with this patch ? There are certain limitations as documented in the NOTE. I think those can be addressed in subsequent patches. Also we may have to change the OVN Northbound db's DNS table to add a new column to have a reference to the ports."}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-12-20 15:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

I am fine with the patch, thanks @Numan'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-20 15:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-22 11:16:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add native DNS support

OVN supports native DNS. This patch makes use of this feature for
internal DNS resolution. With this, VMs within the same network can use
the 'dns_name' associated with the other ports. When the VMs send the
DNS request, it is resolved by ovn-controller if the dns is configured
in the 'DNS' table in the OVN Northbound db.

For each network, a DNS row is created and the 'records' column contain
the dns names and the ip addresses to resolve. The dns record is added
only of the 'dns_name', 'dns_assignment' and 'device_id' of the port is
set.

In order to use this feature, "dns" extension driver should be loaded
and 'dns_domain' in neutron.conf should be defined other than 'openstack.local'.

Change-Id: I59bdc0bc2665118fe8025a12a1c1961e04444abc
Closes-bug: #1688172

commit_message:
Add native DNS support

OVN supports native DNS. This patch makes use of this feature for
internal DNS resolution. With this, VMs within the same network can use
the 'dns_name' associated with the other ports. When the VMs send the
DNS request, it is resolved by ovn-controller if the dns is configured
in the 'DNS' table in the OVN Northbound db.

For each network, a DNS row is created and the 'records' column contain
the dns names and the ip addresses to resolve. The dns record is added
only of the 'dns_name', 'dns_assignment' and 'device_id' of the port is
set.

In order to use this feature, "dns" extension driver should be loaded
and 'dns_domain' in neutron.conf should be defined other than 'openstack.local'.

Change-Id: I59bdc0bc2665118fe8025a12a1c1961e04444abc
Closes-bug: #1688172

commit_message:
Fix docs builds

With the new way of generating docs in the gate[1] our autodoc builds
are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ifbd16fe364bb216821125c70bb7d3ab0ac1f10a3

commit_message:
Drop flavor name validation in horizon side.

This patch drop name validation in horizon and
let nova check if the is name is valid or not.
Instead of using pattern in the flavors form,
pattern will be checked in the nova. Also I
added limation for the name size with tests to
check the max size since the min size has it's unit
test.

Closes-Bug: 1738328
Change-Id: Ib4f6f9b87560df43819d992254603e55ea8ff6a3

commit_message:
Break TestMappingPurge into multiple tests

The previous approach tested all the possible scenarios for passing
arguments to the `mapping_purge` utility in a single test case. This
patch isolates each scenario into it's own dedicated test case for
easier readability.

Change-Id: I698ae00cc412f5f5048c9a983748ac3687a7715a

commit_message:
Prevent duplicate pull_from_zanata on the same repo

If django and python modules are on the same repo, propose translation
script overwrites on the second run with pull_from_zanata files from
other modules. This is not required because the full project files
will already fetched on the first run.

see
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/master/propose-translation-update/4826efb/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-16_06_38_59_479293

Change-Id: I02f8bf74e9bd8f572877368e3e13d950d6639768

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)

Change-Id: I56a99e40a156e54923ea40fc71b18194e3ee8f7c
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] Separate API schemas (allocation_candidate)

In compute APIs, they have their schemas in the
independent directory (nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas).
Placement APIs should be like that as well.

This patch separates API schemas to an independent directory
(nova/api/openstack/placement/schemas)
from nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation_candidate.py.

Change-Id: I56a99e40a156e54923ea40fc71b18194e3ee8f7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-10 15:12:01.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Provide support for SFC deployments

This patch allows to deploy SFC capable deployments when deploying OSA with
ODL. It does the following:

- Installs the neutron networking-sfc project
- Adds SFC to the features which ODL activates
- Incorporates SFC options to neutron.conf

Change-Id: I6bf2be1aef1bb612640f5d8cc101136f618fabd8
'}, {'created': '2017-10-10 15:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Provide support for SFC deployments

This patch allows to deploy SFC capable deployments when deploying OSA with
ODL. It does the following:

- Installs the neutron networking-sfc project
- Adds SFC to the features which ODL activates
- Incorporates SFC options to neutron.conf

In order to use it, you need to have ODL running and you should add the next
items to the neutron_plugin_base when executing it:

networking_sfc.services.flowclassifier.plugin.FlowClassifierPlugin
networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.SfcPlugin

Change-Id: I6bf2be1aef1bb612640f5d8cc101136f618fabd8

commit_message:
Provide support for SFC deployments

This patch allows to deploy SFC capable deployments when deploying OSA with
ODL. It does the following:

- Installs the neutron networking-sfc project
- Adds SFC to the features which ODL activates
- Incorporates SFC options to neutron.conf

In order to use it, you need to have ODL running and you should add the next
items to the neutron_plugin_base when executing it:

networking_sfc.services.flowclassifier.plugin.FlowClassifierPlugin
networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.SfcPlugin

Depends-On: I49c01fb63054e45bae5ae45a89cce986579959de
Change-Id: I6bf2be1aef1bb612640f5d8cc101136f618fabd8

commit_message:
Add database-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the database-delete command.

The trove command database-delete is now:
    openstack database db delete

Change-Id: I7e56326b8f60624c2f408046055a10a42ea4d183
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Avoid using gather_facts as a variable

Ansible throws a warning when we use gather_facts as a variable. This
patches changes the variable to osa_gather_facts to avoid warnings.

Closes-Bug: 1722604
Change-Id: Ic0a46b93e1ba62bc8e99e2d0a279c361a168690b
(cherry picked from commit 64608d4edaedf20aaa17b7a6683d4d29680598ca)

Now that another feature is being added (SRIOV) the logic is harder to understand, and the complexity will only grow when we add more features."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-24 17:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

See [1] as an idea for how we might improve the logic for ensuring the various derived parameter workflows are executed in the proper order.

subject: zuul: Remove duplicated TEMPEST_PLUGINS entry
messages: [{'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-12-15 17:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-12-20 14:26:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nDon't we REALLY MEAN IT when we do it twice? :)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 17:04:02.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Remove duplicated TEMPEST_PLUGINS entry

We don't need to have two TEMPEST_PLUGINS entry of the same value of
/opt/stack/new/ironic-tempest-plugin. One is enough.

Change-Id: I7d91b28d32e42acab91c4bcef42d46e2dfac9094
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: Remove duplicated TEMPEST_PLUGINS entry

We don't need to have two TEMPEST_PLUGINS entry of the same value of
/opt/stack/new/ironic-tempest-plugin. One is enough.

Change-Id: I7d91b28d32e42acab91c4bcef42d46e2dfac9094

Nit update, please'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Nit update, please

lol, done.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2017-11-23 10:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-23 15:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

We should not deprecate something that is actively being used within keystone. It creates a frustrating user experience because the user cannot correct the problem and remove the warning from their logs. If we want to deprecate this we should also clean up our own usage of it.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-24 02:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-24 02:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> We should not deprecate something that is actively being used
 > within keystone. It creates a frustrating user experience because
 > the user cannot correct the problem and remove the warning from
 > their logs. If we want to deprecate this we should also clean up
 > our own usage of it.

these two config options now are used in two places:
1. keystone-manag bootstrp. In this case, we'll log a warning only when it's called the first time. 
2. create role API. In this case ,we'll log a warning only when users create the specified role.
Is that make sense?"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-24 02:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-24 04:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2017-11-24 08:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> 1. keystone-manag bootstrp. In this case, we'll log a warning only when it's called the first time. 

The problem is the user has no choice in this, they'll see a warning and there's nothing they can do about it. We should only be emitting warnings when there is something the user should be doing to make the warning go away. We should come up with a plan to remove the ensure_default_role call from the bootstrap command completely.

> 2. create role API. In this case ,we'll log a warning only when users create the specified role.

I think this might not be necessary, the deprecation warning already notifies the user of this. We can just remove that code from the controller after the deprecation period."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 08:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-27 09:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Colleen,
I came up with two solutions here:
1. add a new arg for "keystone-manage bootstrap", such as --default-member-role, the default value is "True". The code will be like:

if default-member-role:
    LOG.warning("the member role is deprecated, please set default-"
                "member-role to False to stop creaing.")
    create_memeber_role()

Then this arg 's default value will be set to False in Rock, and will be removed with member_role_id in S release.

2. Let the CONF.member_role_id and CONF.member_role_name to be None.

if CONF.member_role_id is not None:
    LOG.warning("the member role is deprecated, please set the config"
                "option to None to stop creaing.")
    create_memeber_role()

Then we can remove member_role_id and member_role_name in Rock directly.

Is that make sense? Or any other idea? Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-27 15:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I think option 1 makes sense. Since bootstrap is the only thing at this point using those conf options, I don't think we'd need option 2 if the behavior was controllable from the cli."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-28 01:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2017-11-28 09:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Deprecate member_role_id and member_role_name

``member_role_id`` and ``member_role_name`` config options
are only used for V2. Instead of removing, just deprecate
them because that maybe some consumers still use them
for V3.

This patch also removed the usage in
``keystone-manage bootstrap`` as well.

Closes-bug: #1728690

bp: deprecated-as-of-queens
bp: removed-as-of-queens

Change-Id: Ib85479442ec68f9a67615c23e5c39bd217c9b109

minor update.

commit_message:
Check for yum lock befor all yum* operations.

A previous (failed/hanging?) yum process blocks 'yum makecache'
 and 'yum check-update' operations, which leads to timeout during
minor update.

Change-Id: I461c1c722944813493f53f339054f420d6ddbe15
Related-Bug: #1704131

[{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-10-30 15:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2017-10-30 15:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The previous "current-tripleo/stable" images correspond to "current-tripleo-rdo" in the new system (so the Phase1 promoted images). If we want to keep these release files identical, please use "current-tripleo-rdo".'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-10-30 16:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-11-12 14:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2017-11-12 19:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Why are we removing dlrn_hash_tag references from the images?
That would be a backwards move'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-11-12 21:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-11-12 21:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Ronelle, it's not move backwards, it's fixing bugs. rh1 mirror doesn't have dlrn hashes in folder names and won't have most likely. These links will be broken, it's continue of fixes here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518629/

rdoproject images didn't have dlrn hash before in these files and they are from different releases - master/ocata, pike/ocata, ocata/newton. What dlrn hash can we set there?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

lgtm though grep gives me a few more hits fyi (but newton and even mitaka...):

./config/release/newton.yml:2:undercloud_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/newton/delorean/consistent/stable/undercloud.qcow2
./config/release/trunk/newton.yml:2:undercloud_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/newton/delorean/consistent/stable/undercloud.qcow2
./config/release/trunk/mitaka.yml:2:undercloud_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/mitaka/delorean/consistent/stable/undercloud.qcow2
./config/release/mitaka.yml:2:undercloud_image_url: https://images.rdoproject.org/mitaka/delorean/consistent/stable/undercloud.qcow2
./config/release/centosci/newton.yml:3:undercloud_image_url: http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/newton/delorean/consistent/stable/undercloud.qcow2'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-15 03:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2017-12-20 12:33:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Correct links for images

Fix links for images by removing "stable" from URLs.
Fix rdoproject links to current promotion links.

Change-Id: Id8465923a7a5cf5325f12cab1dbfccde0d5e20ee

The backup AP is becoming a mess IMO, and I'm not a fan of adding another UUID to the list output.  I would like to understand the "need" for this other than you can do it.  IMO this sort of thing could/should be handled by filtered searches conducted by the admin.

I'd also like to discuss whether or not the backup service should still be considered an extension or not.  Things are getting messy with it's implementation at this point with some things in contrib, others in the proper V3 dirs and views still using the base viewbuilder class.

Regardless of how everybody else feels about adding user-id to every object list/show, the implementation of the API needs to be addressed first before adding any more to it IMO.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2017-09-10 17:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

One other thing before I forget, if this does go forward as is, you must provide an equivalent cinderclient change to address the micro-version bump.'}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2017-09-10 17:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add user_id field to backup show and list with details

The 'user_id' is a necessary and useful field for backup, which is now
only stored in database and Cinder user has no way to get this property
of backup object. This patch adds this support.

Change-Id: I5180396af921473a8268993c8525024666bf605b
Closes-Bug: #1716151

commit_message:
Make AFS marker roles honor sphinx variables

We set a sphinx_build_dir already on jobs. Make write-root-marker,
prepare-docs-for-afs and prepare-infra-docs-for-afs honor it by default.

Change-Id: I7c3d578a00a4aa4c9e175f5f83e3171c6f6a4a61

playbooks: inventory: ceph: Use distribution packages for SUSE

The Ceph packages are already in the default distribution repositories
so make use of them.

commit_message:
Move admin commands from ! to ~

Due to an unfortunate bot command character collision,
move admin commands from ! to ~.

Take the opportunity to properly document them.

Change-Id: Ida77e6262e6da9dade64e6ff9ebca1e41b291b30

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 15:40:16.000000000', 'message': 'Disable functional jobs on docs or reno changes

This commit disables tempest and install jobs on changes that only
modify documentation, releasenotes or .rst files. Please note that it
overrides odd tempest job rules, that disabled jobs on patchs that only
modify requirements.txt or setup.cfg. Both those files affect Kuryr
functionality and modifications in them should be tested.

Change-Id: I868bfb16470d79828ba2d3d23e034439b1a333c5
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 15:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Disable functional jobs on docs or reno changes

This commit disables tempest and install jobs on changes that only
modify documentation, releasenotes or .rst files. Please note that it
overrides odd tempest job rules, that disabled jobs on patches that only
modify requirements.txt or setup.cfg. Both those files affect Kuryr

commit_message:
Disable functional jobs on docs or reno changes

This commit disables tempest and install jobs on changes that only
modify documentation, releasenotes or .rst files. Please note that it
overrides odd tempest job rules, that disabled jobs on patches that only
modify requirements.txt or setup.cfg. Both those files affect Kuryr
functionality and modifications to them should be tested.

Change-Id: I868bfb16470d79828ba2d3d23e034439b1a333c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 16:27:03.000000000', 'message': "Support kuryr-daemon when running containerized

This commit implements kuryr-daemon support when
KURYR_K8S_CONTAINERIZED_DEPLOYMENT=True. It's done by:

* CNI docker image installs Kuryr-Kubernetes pip package and adds
  exectution of kuryr-daemon into entrypoint script..
* Hosts /proc and /var/lib/openvswitch are mounted into the CNI
  conainer.
* Code is changed to use /host_proc instead of /proc when in a container
  (it's impossible to mount host's /proc into container' /proc.

Implements: blueprint cni-split-exec-daemon

Change-Id: I9155a2cba28f578cee129a4c40066209f7ab543d

commit_message:
Support kuryr-daemon when running containerized

This commit implements kuryr-daemon support when
KURYR_K8S_CONTAINERIZED_DEPLOYMENT=True. It's done by:

* CNI docker image installs Kuryr-Kubernetes pip package and adds
  exectution of kuryr-daemon into entrypoint script.
* Hosts /proc and /var/run/openvswitch are mounted into the CNI
  container.
* Code is changed to use /host_proc instead of /proc when in a container
  (it's impossible to mount host's /proc into container's /proc).

Implements: blueprint cni-split-exec-daemon

Change-Id: I9155a2cba28f578cee129a4c40066209f7ab543d

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I12fe30e11c7462b6cada89b12946c0cd6fae1607

subject: Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2017-12-20 14:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2017-12-20 14:21:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nI see, so now we're setting the instance task_state before calling the Cinder API."}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2017-12-20 14:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-20 14:01:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition

While performing assisted volume snapshots, we're setting the
instance task state to 'image_snapshot_pending' in order to prevent
instance actions that would impact this operation.

The issue is that we're clearing the task state only after calling
back the Cinder API, telling it that the snapshot was created or
deleted. For this reason, a subsequent assisted snapshot request
will be rejected by the Nova API if the task state is not cleared
in time.

This race condition affects quite a few tempest tests that cover
this scenario.

This change ensures that the instance task state is cleared before
calling back the Cinder API.

Closes-Bug: #1739423

Change-Id: I1ae57c109ed551ba03d49b2ac7c6318b3939526d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix assisted volume snapshots race condition

While performing assisted volume snapshots, we're setting the
instance task state to 'image_snapshot_pending' in order to prevent
instance actions that would impact this operation.

The issue is that we're clearing the task state only after calling
back the Cinder API, telling it that the snapshot was created or
deleted. For this reason, a subsequent assisted snapshot request
will be rejected by the Nova API if the task state is not cleared
in time.

This race condition affects quite a few tempest tests that cover
this scenario.

This change ensures that the instance task state is cleared before
calling back the Cinder API.

Closes-Bug: #1739423

Change-Id: I1ae57c109ed551ba03d49b2ac7c6318b3939526d

commit_message:
storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711
(cherry picked from commit 268c1e8e9e519b57f9b8c271f806efba0d4651e1)

commit_message:
storage: fix upgrade when password contains a %

oslo.config doesn't support %{} or %() variable interpolation while
ConfigParser does.

So when a password contains a '%', it's fine for oslo.config
But the Python ConfigParser will raise the exception.

Since alembic use ConfigParser and not oslo.config, we have to escape
the url ourself.

This is not a big deal since, we don't want alembic doing variable
interpolation.

Change-Id: If7bfe7f082f4352fb49992a2216f2dd5b8993711
(cherry picked from commit 268c1e8e9e519b57f9b8c271f806efba0d4651e1)

commit_message:
Add user-delete to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the user-delete command.

The trove command user-delete is now:
    openstack database user delete

Change-Id: Ie11a2a41dfca0e1f58e155eaf7c5949e11352c6a
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

This patch adds a new variable to the mistral
environment 'tripleo.undercloud-config' allowing
to retrieve the root password for the MySQL
databases. Now this variable can be accessed from any
Mistral workflow.
Also, this patch adds the ability of checking if
the variables are not loaded properly due to
an upgrade, in that case we update the Mistral

commit_message:
Load undercloud DB password to a mistral environment

This patch adds a new variable to the mistral
environment 'tripleo.undercloud-config' allowing
to retrieve the root password for the MySQL
databases. Now this variable can be accessed from any
Mistral workflow.
Also, this patch adds the ability of checking if
the variables are not loaded properly due to
an upgrade, in that case we update the Mistral
environment to have all the variables in place.

Change-Id: I822c3d96b5805909656d8e92e963b851f3bd77de

commit_message:
Use native v3 tox jobs

Instead of a legacy tox job, use the already defined functional jobs
that do the same. Note that those jobs are named "functional", so update
tox.ini as well.

Remove unused playbooks.

Change-Id: Icdb1b94b0e69ffb55007e166705871010e8943c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 18:51:13.000000000', 'message': "Testing

[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6df49741ddf8fd28f78cebca4dca55d34a07a5a1)

one job
Change-Id: I0bd8f061789e67b3515fa3949c5cb13f2da6fc52
"}]
commit_message:
Testing

[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6df49741ddf8fd28f78cebca4dca55d34a07a5a1)

one job
Change-Id: I0bd8f061789e67b3515fa3949c5cb13f2da6fc52

(3 comments)

At the PTG in Denver, we decided to reevaluate the Canonical exporter as to reduce the amount of technical debt we need to carry. After some fiddling with settings, I've been able to get the Canonical exporter running successfully and am fairly confident it exposes the metrics we'd like out of the box. If we wanted to get additional metrics for the services to reflect usage, the ceilometer exporter may be an approach to consider.  However, I think that's a separate effort from what was initially planned here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-14 22:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add specification for Prometheus exporter

OSH's Prometheus exporter specification. It's assumed to be a design to be
discussed with the rest of the community.

Change-Id: Iad6396c0ef71ef10bb8516156c06277a203d217d
Co-Authored-By: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>

commit_message:
More elaborate fluentd filtering

This commit attempts at implementing more elaborate filtering in our
fluentd. Right now it:

* Updates fluentd version and provides Dockerfile that installs
  fluent-plugin-concat on top.
* Switches log source from /var/lib/docker/containers to
  /var/lib/containers. This enables kubernetes_metadata filter to
  actually do its work.
* Separates OpenStack services logs (tag openstack.*) and other services
  logs (tag kubernetes.*).
* Extracts log level from oslo.log messages.
* Groups multiline traceback log messages from OpenStack services into
  one log.

Change-Id: I73045af51e22d4eb80d04ce41a3de8c9e4e82332
Co-Authored-by: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>

commit_message:
WIP - Support aggregate affinity filters

DO NOT MERGE

Getting weird failures in unrelated functional tests that seem to be
caused by leftover state not being cleaned up in between test method
runs?

(2 comments)

I'm a little disturbed that this didn't require unit test changes, which is probably how the bug crept in in the first place.  It sounds like there are two good followups here:

1) Unit test coverage for this functionality.

2) Better user experience around partial updates.  Some sort of retry mechanism to complete partial updates if they can't all be done in one shot.

However, this change doesn't introduce any new tech debt and it fixes the bug so I'm good with it merging as-is."}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2017-12-13 01:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Rework translation templates

Currently we run the post job for each and every change, even if that
branch is not set up in Zanata for translation.

Since we have already branch specific templates, let's use them and add
a post job for each of them that mirrors the periodic job.

This way we only run a post job on a branch if we also have a
corresponding periodic job to import changes back.

Change-Id: I6b647ecee41f1d41f0d59f913d5213046b253b22

commit_message:
Remove obsolete dashboard tox jobs

Remove special dashboard tox jobs, we can use the horizon ones since they
are generic.

The dependent change removed all usage of these jobs.

Change-Id: I56fc1d74b8d1a0d8b42436ed1a18b9196e68c270
Depends-On: I18e09aef00dd8d97768f8dbf05c8e9165156a6bb
